24.Abdul Hye: Don’t you see how Allah sets forth an example of a good word as a good tree, whose roots are firm, and its branches are in the sky?

25.Abdul Hye: It gives its fruit at all times by the permission of its Lord. Allah sets forth examples for mankind in order that they may remember.

26.Abdul Hye: The example of an evil word is that of an evil tree uprooted from the surface of the earth with no stability.

27.Abdul Hye: Those who believe with the word that stands firm, Allah will keep them firm in the life of this world and Hereafter. Those who are wrongdoers, Allah will cause them to go astray. Allah does what He wills.

28.Abdul Hye: Have you not seen those who have changed the blessings of Allah into disbelief, and have caused their people to reside in the house of destruction?

29.Abdul Hye: Hell, in which they will burn, and what an evil place to settle in!

30.Abdul Hye: They set up rivals to Allah, to mislead people from His way! Say: “Enjoy (your brief life)! But certainly, your destination is the hell fire!”

31.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad) to My devotees who have believed, that they should establish prayer, and spend in charity from what We have provided them secretly and openly; before a Day comes in which there will be neither mutual bargaining nor friendship.

32.Abdul Hye: Allah is the one Who has created the heavens and the earth, sends down water (rain) from the sky, and thereby brings forth fruits as provision for you. He has made the ships to be of service to you, that they may sail through the sea by His Command; and He has made rivers to be of service to you.

33.Abdul Hye: And He has made the sun and the moon to be of service to you, both constantly pursuing their courses; and He has made the night and the day to be of service to you.

34.Abdul Hye: And He has given you all that you have asked for, and if you count the blessings of Allah, you will not be able to count them. Surely! Human being is unjust, ungrateful

35.Abdul Hye: (Remember) when Abraham said: “O my Lord! Make this city (Makkah) safe, and keep me and my sons away from the worship of idols.

36.Abdul Hye: O my Lord! Surely they (idols) have led many people astray. So, those who follow me, surely they are of mine. Whoever disobeys me, still You are indeed Forgiving, Merciful.

37.Abdul Hye: O our Lord! Surely I have made some of my offspring to reside in a valley not with cultivation near Your sacred house (the Ka’bah). O our Lord! (I have done this) in order that they would establish prayers; so turn hearts among mankind love towards them, and (O Allah) provide them with fruits so that they may give thanks.

38.Abdul Hye: O our Lord! Certainly, You know what we conceal and what we reveal. Nothing on the earth or in the heaven is hidden from Allah.

39.Abdul Hye: All the praises and thanks are to Allah, Who has given me Ishmael and Isaac in my old age. Surely! My Lord indeed is All-Hearer of prayers.

40.Abdul Hye: O my Lord! Make me one who establishes prayers perfectly, and from my offspring. Our Lord! Accept my prayer.

41.Abdul Hye: Our Lord! Forgive me, my parents, and all the believers on the Day when the reckoning will be established.”

42.Abdul Hye: You don’t think that Allah is unaware of what the wrongdoers do. Only He gives them respite up to that Day when their eyes will stare in horror,

43.Abdul Hye: (they will be) rushing forward with necks outstretched, their heads will be raised up (towards the sky), their gaze will not return towards them, and their hearts will be empty (because of fear).

44.Abdul Hye: And warn (O Muhammad) mankind of the Day when the punishment will come to them; then those who wronged will say: “Our Lord! Respite us for a little while, we will answer Your Call and follow the Messengers!” (It will be said): “Did you not sworn before that you would never leave?

45.Abdul Hye: And you lived in the residences of those who wronged themselves and it was clear to you how We had dealt with them. And We (even) put forth examples for you.”

46.Abdul Hye: Indeed, they planned their plot, but their plots were within the sight of Allah, even though their plot was such that it could move the mountains.

47.Abdul Hye: So, don’t think that Allah will fail to keep His Promise to His Messengers. Certainly, Allah is All-Mighty, All-Able of retribution.

48.Abdul Hye: On the Day when the earth will be changed to other than earth and the heavens (as well), and all creatures will appear before Allah, the One, and the Irresistible,

49.Abdul Hye: and on that Day you will see the sinners bound together in fetters (their hands and feet tied to their necks with chains),

50.Abdul Hye: their garments will be of tar, and fire will cover their faces.

51.Abdul Hye: Allah will requite each person according to its deeds. Truly, Allah is swift at reckoning.

52.Abdul Hye: This (Qur’an) is a message for mankind, in order that they may be warned thereby; and that they may know that Allah is the only one worthy of worship, and that people of understanding may take heed.

1.Abdul Hye: Alif-Lam-Ra. These are the Verses of the book and a plain Qur’an.

2.Abdul Hye: Perhaps (the Day will come when) those who disbelieve wish that they were Muslims.

3.Abdul Hye: Leave them (alone) to eat, let them enjoy, and be preoccupied (with false) hope. They will come to know (the truth)!

4.Abdul Hye: And Allah did not destroy a town but there was a known decree for it.

5.Abdul Hye: No nation can advance its term (fate), nor delay it.

6.Abdul Hye: And they say: “O you (Muhammad) to whom the reminder (the Qur’an) has been sent down! Surely, you are insane.

7.Abdul Hye: Why don’t you bring angels to us if you are of the truthful ones?”

8.Abdul Hye: We don’t send down the angels except with the truth (for punishment), and when they come, they (the disbelievers) are not given respite!

9.Abdul Hye: Truly, We have sent down the reminder (the Qur’an), and surely, We will guard it.

10.Abdul Hye: Indeed, We sent (Messengers) before you (O Muhammad) amongst the early communities;

11.Abdul Hye: and any Messenger came to them, they mocked at him.

12.Abdul Hye: Thus We let it (disbelief) enter into the hearts of the sinners;

13.Abdul Hye: so they don’t believe in it (the Qur’an), though the examples of (Allah’s punishment of) the ancients have passed.

14.Abdul Hye: And even if We had opened to them a gate from the heaven and they continue to ascend through it

15.Abdul Hye: surely they would have said: “Our eyes have been blocked (blurred). But nay, we have been bewitched.”

16.Abdul Hye: And indeed, We have put big stars in the heaven and beautified it for the beholders;

17.Abdul Hye: and We have protected them from every outcast devil.

18.Abdul Hye: Except him (devil) who steals a hearing, he is pursued by a clear flaming fire.

19.Abdul Hye: And We have spread the earth and placed firm mountains in it; and caused to grow therein every thing balanced (in due proportion),

20.Abdul Hye: and Allah has made provision for you therein means of living, and for those whom you don’t provide.

21.Abdul Hye: And there is not a thing but its (inexhaustible) treasures are with Us. And We have not sent it down except in a known measure.

22.Abdul Hye: And We send the fertilizing winds (fill clouds with water), then causes the water (rain) to descend from the sky, gives it to you to drink, and it is not you who is able to store.

23.Abdul Hye: And certainly We! It is We Who give life, cause death, and We are the Inheritors.

24.Abdul Hye: And indeed, We know the first generations of you who have passed away, and indeed, We know the present generations who will come afterwards.

25.Abdul Hye: And surely, your Lord will gather them. Truly, He is the All-Wise, the All-Knower.

26.Abdul Hye: And indeed, We created human from clay of mud altered into shape.

27.Abdul Hye: And the jinn, We created it before from fire of smokeless flame.

28.Abdul Hye: And (remember) when your Lord said to the angels: “Surely, I am going to create a human (Adam) from clay mud altered into shape,

29.Abdul Hye: when I have fashioned him and breathed into him the soul (which Allah created for him), then you fall down prostrating before him.”

30.Abdul Hye: So, the angels prostrated all of them together,

31.Abdul Hye: except Satan, he refused to be with those who prostrated.

32.Abdul Hye: (Allah) said: “O Satan! What is your reason that you are not with those who prostrated?”

33.Abdul Hye: (Satan) said: “I am not the one to prostrate to a human whom You have created from clay of mud molded into shape.”

34.Abdul Hye: (Allah) said: “Then, get out from here, for surely you are accursed.

35.Abdul Hye: Surely, the curse will be upon you till the Day of recompense.”

36.Abdul Hye: (Satan) said: “O my Lord! Give me respite till the Day of Resurrection.”

37.Abdul Hye: Allah said: “Then surely, you are given the respit

38.Abdul Hye: till the Day of appointed time.”

39.Abdul Hye: (Satan) said: “O my Lord! Since You let me go astray, I shall indeed adorn (path of error) for them (mankind) on the earth, and I shall mislead them all

40.Abdul Hye: except those who are Your sincere devotees.”

41.Abdul Hye: (Allah) said: “This is the way straight to Me

42.Abdul Hye: Certainly, you will have no authority over My devotees, except those who follow you of the ones who go astray.

43.Abdul Hye: And surely, hell is the promised place for them all,

44.Abdul Hye: it (hell) has 7 gates; each gate will be assigned to a separate class (for sinners) from them.

45.Abdul Hye: Truly! The pious people will be in the midst of the gardens and water-springs (of Paradise).

46.Abdul Hye: (It will be said to them): “Enter therein (Paradise) in peace and security.”

47.Abdul Hye: And We shall remove all hatred from their hearts, so they will be like brothers and sit on couches face to face.

48.Abdul Hye: No fatigue will touch them in it, nor shall they be removed from it.

49.Abdul Hye: Inform (O Muhammad) to My devotees that truly, I am the Forgiving, the Merciful,

50.Abdul Hye: but My Punishment is also the most painful punishment.

51.Abdul Hye: And tell them about the guests (the angels) of Abraham.

52.Abdul Hye: They entered upon him and said: “Peace!” Abraham replied: “Indeed! We are afraid of you.”

53.Abdul Hye: They (the angels) said: “Don’t be afraid! We truly bring to you glad tidings of a son (possessing) knowledge.”

54.Abdul Hye: Abraham said: “Do you give me glad tidings (of a son) when old age has overtaken me? What kind of glad tidings you are giving?”

55.Abdul Hye: They (the angels) said: “We give you glad tidings in truth. So don’t be those who despair.”

56.Abdul Hye: (Abraham) said: “Who despairs of the Mercy of his Lord except those who are astray?”

57.Abdul Hye: (Abraham again) said: “Then what is your mission, O Messengers?”

58.Abdul Hye: They (the angels) said: “We have been sent (to punish) the people who are criminals,

59.Abdul Hye: except the family of Lot. We truly will save them all (from destruction),

60.Abdul Hye: except his wife, Allah has decreed that she shall be of those who will stay behind (to be destroyed).”

61.Abdul Hye: When the Messengers (the angels) came to the family of Lot,

62.Abdul Hye: he said: “Surely! You are people unknown to me.”

63.Abdul Hye: They said: “Nay, we have come to you with that (punishment) concerning which they have doubts.

64.Abdul Hye: We have brought you the truth (news of destruction of your nation) and we are telling the truth.

65.Abdul Hye: Then travel with your family during the last part of the night, and you follow from their rear; no one of you look back, but go on where you are ordered to go.”

66.Abdul Hye: And We have made this decree known to him that the roots of those (sinners) will be cut off in the early morning.

67.Abdul Hye: And the people of the city came (to Lot’s house) rejoicing (at the news of the 2 young male visitors).

68.Abdul Hye: (Lot) said: “Surely! These are my guests, so don’t disgrace me.

69.Abdul Hye: And fear Allah and don’t disgrace me.”

70.Abdul Hye: They (people of the city) said: “Did we not forbid you from (entertaining) any of the people?”

71.Abdul Hye: (Lot) said: “These (the girls of the nation) are my daughters (to marry lawfully), if you must act.”

72.Abdul Hye: Truly, by your life (O Muhammad), they were wandering blindly in their wild intoxication.

73.Abdul Hye: So the awful blast overtook them at the time of sunrise.

74.Abdul Hye: And We turned it (towns of Sodom in Palestine) upside down and rained to them stones of baked clay.

75.Abdul Hye: Surely! In this are signs for those who see,

76.Abdul Hye: And surely, they (the cities) are on an established road (from Makkah to Syria i.e. the place where the Dead Sea is now).

77.Abdul Hye: Surely! Therein is indeed a sign for the believers.

78.Abdul Hye: And surely, the people in the wood (the people of Midian to whom Prophet Shuaib was sent by Allah) were also wrongdoers.

79.Abdul Hye: So, We took vengeance on them. They are both (ruined) on a clear road.

80.Abdul Hye: And surely, the people of Hijr (the rocky tract) denied the Messengers.

81.Abdul Hye: And We gave them Our Verses, but they were averse to them.

82.Abdul Hye: And they used to cut out secure homes in the mountains.

83.Abdul Hye: But the awful blast overtook them in the early morning

84.Abdul Hye: and all their earnings (building homes by craving the rock) did not avail.

85.Abdul Hye: And We have not created the heavens, the earth, and all that is between them except with truth. Surely, the Hour (of Doom) is coming, so overlook (O Muhammad) their faults with gracious forgiveness.

86.Abdul Hye: Surely, your Lord is the All-Knowing Creator.

87.Abdul Hye: And indeed, We have given you 7 of the repeatedly recited Verses (Al-Fatihah) and the Glorious Qur’an.

88.Abdul Hye: Don’t look with your eyes at what We have bestowed on certain classes of them (disbelievers), nor grieve over them. And lower your wings (be courteous) to the believers.

89.Abdul Hye: And say (O Muhammad): “I am indeed the plain Warner.”

90.Abdul Hye: As We have sent down (this warning) on the dividers

91.Abdul Hye: who have made the Qur’an into parts (believe some parts and deny others).

92.Abdul Hye: So, by your Lord (O Muhammad), We shall certainly ask them all,

93.Abdul Hye: about what they used to do.

94.Abdul Hye: Therefore proclaim that which you are commanded and turn away from the polytheists.

95.Abdul Hye: Truly! We will suffice you against the scoffers (mockers),

96.Abdul Hye: who set up another deity along with Allah, so they will come to know.

97.Abdul Hye: Indeed, We know that your heart is distressed by what they say.

98.Abdul Hye: So, glorify the praises of your Lord, be of those who prostrate (to Him),

99.Abdul Hye: and worship your Lord until the certainty (death) comes to you.

1.Abdul Hye: The Command of Allah has come, so don’t seek to hasten it. Glorified is He and above all that they associate as partners with (Him).

2.Abdul Hye: He sends down the angels with the revelation of His Command to whom He wills of His servants (saying): “Warn (mankind) that there is no one worthy of worship but I, so fear Me.”

3.Abdul Hye: He has created the heavens and the earth with truth. He is exalted above all they associate as partners (with Him).

4.Abdul Hye: He has created human from semen, yet the he becomes an open opponent.

5.Abdul Hye: And He has created the cattle for you; in them there is warmth (clothing), numerous benefits, and you eat some of them.

6.Abdul Hye: And there is beauty in them for you when you bring them home in the evening and when you lead them to pasture in the morning.

7.Abdul Hye: And they carry your loads to a land where you could not reach except with great trouble to yourselves. Truly, your Lord is Kind, Merciful.

8.Abdul Hye: And (He has created) horses, mules, and donkeys so that you may ride them and as an adornment. And He has created (others about which) you have no knowledge.

9.Abdul Hye: And upon Allah is (to show) the direction of the Right Way, but there are some of them (ways) that are crooked. And had He willed, He could have guided you all.

10.Abdul Hye: It is He Who sends down water (rain) from the sky, from it you drink and from it grows vegetation therein to pasture your cattle.

11.Abdul Hye: With it He grows for you the crops, the olives, the date-palms, the grapes, and every kind of fruit. Surely, there is a sign in this for people who think.

12.Abdul Hye: And He has subjected to you the night and the day, the sun and the moon; and the stars are subjected by His Command. Surely, there are signs in this for people who understand.

13.Abdul Hye: And He has created for you on this earth of varying colors. Surely, there is a sign in this for people who remember.

14.Abdul Hye: And it is He Who has subjected the sea to you so that you may eat fresh tender meat (fish) from it, and that you may bring out ornaments to wear from it, and that you see the ships plough through it. (All these are done) so that you may seek His Bounty and you may give thanks (to Allah).

15.Abdul Hye: He has affixed mountains into the earth standing firm, lest it should shake with you. (He made) rivers and roads so that you may be guided

16.Abdul Hye: and land-marks and the stars for your guidance.

17.Abdul Hye: Is then He, who has created all these, like the one who can not create? Why don’t you remember?

18.Abdul Hye: And if you want to count the Favors of Allah, you can not count them. Surely, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

19.Abdul Hye: And Allah knows what you conceal and what you reveal.

20.Abdul Hye: Those who invoke other than Allah, they have created nothing, and they themselves are created.

21.Abdul Hye: (They are) dead, lifeless, and they don’t know when they will be resurrected.

22.Abdul Hye: Your deity is One (Allah). As for those who don’t believe in the Hereafter, their hearts deny, and they are proud.

23.Abdul Hye: No doubt that Allah knows what they conceal and what they reveal. Surely, He does not like the proud.

24.Abdul Hye: And when they are asked: “What is that your Lord has sent down?” They say: “Tales of the ancient people!”

25.Abdul Hye: They will bear their own burdens in full on the Day of Resurrection, and the burdens of those whom they have misguided without knowledge. Indeed it is evil that they will bear!

26.Abdul Hye: Indeed those before them also plotted, but Allah struck their buildings from the foundations, the roof fell upon them from above, and the punishment came to them from where they did not even perceive.

27.Abdul Hye: Then, on the Day of Resurrection, He will disgrace them and say: “Where are those partners whom you used to associate with (Allah), about whom you used to disagree and dispute (with the believers)?” Those who have been given the knowledge (about the punishment of Allah) will say: “Surely! Today disgrace and misery are upon the disbelievers,

28.Abdul Hye: those whom the angels cause to die while they wronged themselves.” Then they will make false submission (saying): “We were not doing any evil.” (The angels will reply): “Yes! Surely, Allah is the All-Knower of what you used to do.

29.Abdul Hye: So enter the gates of hell to abide in it.” Indeed, what an evil abode for the arrogant.

30.Abdul Hye: And (when) the pious people are asked: “What (is it that) your Lord has sent down?” They say: “(That which is) good.” There is good for those who do good in this world and the home of the Hereafter will be even better. Excellent indeed will be the home (Paradise) of the pious.

31.Abdul Hye: Gardens of Eden (Paradise) which they will enter, rivers flow from beneath them, they will have all that they wish in it. Thus Allah will reward the pious,

32.Abdul Hye: those whose lives the angels take while they are pious saying (to them): “Peace be on you, enter Paradise because of what you used to do.”

33.Abdul Hye: Do they (the disbelievers) wait for the angels to come to them (to take souls at death), or command of your Lord to come? So did those before them. And Allah did not wrong them, but they used to wrong themselves.

34.Abdul Hye: Then, the evil results of what they did overtook them, and surrounded them by that they used to mock at.

35.Abdul Hye: And those who join others in worship (with Allah) say: “If Allah had willed, neither we would have worshipped anything other than Him, nor our forefathers, nor we would have forbidden anything without (command from) Him.” So did those who were before them. Then are the Messengers charged with anything but to convey the clear message?

36.Abdul Hye: And surely, We have sent in every nation a Messenger (saying): “You worship Allah, and avoid false deities.” Then, there were some whom Allah has guided and there were some upon whom the straying was justified. So travel through the land and see what the end of those who denied (the truth) was.

37.Abdul Hye: If you (O Muhammad) desire for their guidance, then surely Allah does not guide whom He lets to go astray. They will have no helpers.

38.Abdul Hye: And they swear their strongest oaths by Allah: “Allah will never raise the dead who dies (to life).” Yes, (He will raise them up), it is a Promise upon Him in truth, but most of mankind don’t know.

39.Abdul Hye: (He will fulfill) in order to illustrate for them that they differ in it, and those who disbelieved may know that they were liars.

40.Abdul Hye: When We intend to do a thing which We want, We only say to it: “Be!” and it is.

41.Abdul Hye: And for those who migrated for the cause of Allah after persecution, We will certainly give them good residence in this world, and indeed the reward of the Hereafter will be greater, if they but knew!

42.Abdul Hye: (They are) those who remained patient (in this world), and put their trust in their Lord.

43.Abdul Hye: We have not send (Messengers) before you (O Muhammad) but men, whom We have sent revelation. So ask those who knows the Scripture (learned people of the Torah and the Gospel), if you don’t know,

44.Abdul Hye: with clear signs and books. And We have sent down to you (O Muhammad) the reminder (the Qur’an) so that you may explain to mankind what was sent down to them so that they may give thought.

45.Abdul Hye: Do those who devise evil plots feel secure that Allah will not sink them into the earth, or that the punishment will not come to them from directions that they don’t perceive?

46.Abdul Hye: Or that He may not seize them in their going to and from (journey) so they will not be able to escape (from His punishment)?

47.Abdul Hye: Or that He may seize them with a gradual wasting (of wealth and health)? Surely! Your Lord is indeed Gracious, Merciful.

48.Abdul Hye: Do they not see how Allah has created from things, their shadows incline to the right and to the left, making prostration to Allah, and they are humble?

49.Abdul Hye: And to Allah prostate all the living creatures that are in the heavens and in the earth, and the angels, and they are not proud,

50.Abdul Hye: they fear their Lord above them, and they do what they are commanded.

51.Abdul Hye: And Allah said (O mankind): “Don’t take – 2 deities. Surely, He is the only one worthy of worship. Then you should fear Me.”

52.Abdul Hye: To Him belongs all that are in the heavens and in the earth and His religion is everlasting. Would you fear any one other than Allah?

53.Abdul Hye: And whatever blessings you have are from Allah. When harm touches you, you cry to Him aloud for help.

54.Abdul Hye: Yet, when He removes the harm from you, behold! Some of you associate others in worship with their Lord,

55.Abdul Hye: so they deny that which (Favors) We have bestowed on them! So enjoy yourselves (short stay), soon you will come to know (the consequences).

56.Abdul Hye: And they assign a portion of what We have provided them (for those deities) about whom they don’t know. By Allah, you shall certainly be asked about what you used to fabricate.

57.Abdul Hye: And they assign daughters to Allah! Glorified is He. To themselves what they desire (sons).

58.Abdul Hye: And when the news of (birth of) a female child is brought to any of them, his face remains dark, and he is filled with inward grief!

59.Abdul Hye: He hides himself from the people because of the evil of what he has been informed. (He asks himself) shall he keep her with dishonor or bury her in the earth? Certainly, evil is what they decide.

60.Abdul Hye: Those who don’t believe in the Hereafter set an evil example, and for Allah is the highest example. And He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

61.Abdul Hye: And if Allah were to seize mankind for their wrong-doing, He would not leave on it (the earth) a single living creature, but He postpones them for an appointed term. When their appointed term comes, neither they can delay it for an Hour nor can they advance it

62.Abdul Hye: They assign to Allah what they dislike. Their tongues describe the falsehood that the better things will be theirs. No doubt that for them is the fire, and they will be sent ahead of the others.

63.Abdul Hye: By Allah, indeed We have sent (Messengers) to the nations before you (O Muhammad), but Satan made their deeds fair-seeming to them. So he (Satan) is their helper today (in this world), and they will have a painful punishment.

64.Abdul Hye: And We have not sent down to you (O Muhammad) the book (the Qur’an) except that you may explain to them those things in which they differ, as guidance, and a Mercy for those who believe.

65.Abdul Hye: And Allah sends down water (rain) from the sky, and it gives life in the earth after it has been dead. Surely, in this is a sign for people who listen.

66.Abdul Hye: Surely! In the cattle, there is a lesson for you. We give you to drink of what is in their bellies, between bowels and blood - pure milk; pleasant to the drinkers.

67.Abdul Hye: And (similarly) from the fruits of date-palms and grapes, you derive strong drink from it and good provision. Surely, there is indeed a sign for people who think.

68.Abdul Hye: And your Lord inspired the bees, saying: “Take your habitations in the mountains, in the trees, and in what they (people) erect,

69.Abdul Hye: then eat all fruits and follow the easy ways of your Lord.” There comes forth from their bellies, a drink of different colors, which is healing for people. Surely, in this there is indeed a sign for people who think.

70.Abdul Hye: And Allah has created you, then He will cause you to die, and there are some of you who are sent back to the worst of old age so that they know nothing after having known. Surely! Allah is the All-Knower, All-Powerful.

71.Abdul Hye: And Allah has preferred some of you above others in provision. Those who are preferred will not hand over their wealth to what their right hands possess so that they are equal in it. Then do they deny the Grace of Allah?

72.Abdul Hye: And Allah has given to you your kind wives, and has given to you from your wives, sons and grandsons, and has provided to you good things. Then do they believe in false deities and deny the Favors of Allah?

73.Abdul Hye: They worship others besides Allah, which don’t own anything to provide any provision for them from the heavens and the earth, nor they can.

74.Abdul Hye: So don’t compare anything with Allah. Surely! Allah knows and you don’t know.

75.Abdul Hye: Allah puts forward the example (of 2 men): a captive (disbeliever) under the possession of another, he has no power over anything, and (the other), a man (believer) on whom We have provided a good provision from Us, and he spends from it secretly and openly. Can they be equal? All the praises are to Allah. Nay! But most of them don’t know.

76.Abdul Hye: And Allah puts forward an example of 2 men: one of them is dumb, has no power over anything, and is a burden to his master, whatever way he directs him, he brings no good. Is he equal to one who commands justice, and he is on the Right Way?

77.Abdul Hye: And to Allah (belongs) the unseen of the heavens and the earth. The matter of the Hour (of Judgment) is not but as a twinkling of the eye, or it is even nearer. Surely! Allah has power over everything

78.Abdul Hye: And Allah has brought you out of the wombs of your mothers, you don’t know anything. And He has given you hearing, sight, and intelligence so that you may give thanks (to Allah).

79.Abdul Hye: Do they not see the birds flying in the midst of the sky? None holds them but Allah. Surely, in this are clear signs for people who believe.

80.Abdul Hye: And Allah has made for you in your homes an abode, and made for you out of the hides of the cattle (as tent for) homes which you find light during the day of your travel and during the day of your stay (in travel); and from their wool, fur, and hair, (Allah provides) furniture, articles of convenience (such as carpets, blankets), comfort for a while.

81.Abdul Hye: And Allah has made shades (from sun) for you out of that which He has created. He has made for you places of refuge in the mountains, has made for you garments to protect you from the heat, and coats of armor to protect you from your mutual violence. Thus He perfects His Grace to you so that you may submit (to Islam).

82.Abdul Hye: If they still turn away, then it is only on you (O Muhammad) to convey (the message) in a clear way.

83.Abdul Hye: They recognize the Favors of Allah, yet they deny them and most of them are (ungrateful) disbelievers.

84.Abdul Hye: And (remember) the Day when We shall raise up a witness (their Messenger) from each nation. Then those who have disbelieved will neither be permitted (to excuse), nor will they be allowed to repent.

85.Abdul Hye: And when those who did wrong (disbelievers) will see the punishment, it will neither be lightened for them, nor will they be given respite.

86.Abdul Hye: And when those who associated partners (with Allah) see their partners, they will say: “Our Lord! These are our partners whom we used to invoke besides you.” But they (partners) will throw back their word at them (and say): “Surely! You are liars!”

87.Abdul Hye: And they will offer submission to Allah (alone) on that Day and what they used to invent (false deities) will vanish from them.

88.Abdul Hye: Those who disbelieved and hinder people from the way of Allah, We will add punishment over the punishment for them because they used to spread corruption.

89.Abdul Hye: And (remember) the Day when We shall raise up a witness in every nation against them from amongst themselves. And We shall bring you (O Muhammad) as a witness against them. (For this reason) We have sent down to you the book (the Qur’an) as an explanation of everything, a guide, a Mercy, and glad tidings for the Muslims.

90.Abdul Hye: Surely, Allah enjoins justice, doing good (to others), giving help to kith and kin, and forbids lewdness, evil deeds, and oppression. He admonishes you so that you may take heed.

91.Abdul Hye: And fulfill the Covenant of Allah when you have taken a covenant, and don’t break your oaths after you have confirmed them; and indeed you have appointed Allah over you as guarantor. Surely! Allah knows what you do.

92.Abdul Hye: And don’t be like that (woman) who had spun thread strongly and then undo it by weakening it; nor take your oaths as a means of deception among yourselves so that a nation may take undue advantage over another nation. Only Allah tests you by these (oaths). He will make clear to you on the Day of Resurrection what you used to differ about it.

93.Abdul Hye: And if Allah willed, He could have made you all one nation, but He sends astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. Certainly you will be questioned for what you used to do.

94.Abdul Hye: Don’t take your oaths as a means of deception among yourselves, lest your foot slip after being firmly fixed; and you may have to taste the punishment for hindering people from the Way of Allah, and there will be a great punishment for you.

95.Abdul Hye: And don’t purchase a small gain (at the cost of) Allah’s Covenant. Surely! What is with Allah is better for you if you but knew it.

96.Abdul Hye: Whatever is with you, will be exhausted, and whatever is with Allah, will remain. We will certainly pay those who are patient; their reward will be in proportion to the best of what they used to do.

97.Abdul Hye: Whoever does a righteous deed, whether male or female, while he (or she) is a believer; We will give a good life, and We shall pay such people their reward according to the best of what they used to do.

98.Abdul Hye: When you recite the Qur’an, seek refuge with Allah from Satan, the outcast.

99.Abdul Hye: Surely! He (Satan) has no power over those who believe and put their trust in their Lord.

100.Abdul Hye: Only he (Satan) has power over those who follow him, and those who join partners with Him (Allah).

101.Abdul Hye: And when We change a Verse (of the Qur’an) in place of another Verse, and Allah knows the best of what He sends down, they (disbelievers) say: “You (O Muhammad) are but a forger, liar.” But most of them don’t know.

102.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “The Holy Spirit (angel Gabriel) has brought it (the Qur’an) down from your Lord with truth to strengthen those who believe, and as guidance, and glad tidings to the Muslims.”

103.Abdul Hye: And indeed We know what they (polytheists) say: “It is only a human being who teaches him (Muhammad).” But the language of the man whom they refer to him is foreign, while this (the Qur’an) is a clear Arabic language.

104.Abdul Hye: Surely! Those who don’t believe in the Verses of Allah, Allah will not guide them and for them will be a painful punishment.

105.Abdul Hye: It is only those who don’t believe in the Verses of Allah, fabricate falsehood, and they are liars.

106.Abdul Hye: Whoever is forced to deny faith after its acceptance while the heart is at rest with faith in Allah, shall be forgiven; but whoever opens its heart to disbelief (willingly after accepting the faith), shall incur the wrath from Allah, and for them will be a great punishment.

107.Abdul Hye: That is because they love and prefer the life of this world over that of the Hereafter. Allah does not guide the disbelievers.

108.Abdul Hye: They are those whom Allah has set a seal upon their hearts, their hearings, and their eyes. They are those who are heedless!

109.Abdul Hye: No doubt, they will be the losers in the Hereafter.

110.Abdul Hye: Then surely! Your Lord is Forgiving, Merciful afterwards to those who emigrated after they had been put to trials (for their faith), struggled hard, and were patient.

111.Abdul Hye: (Remember) the Day when every soul will come up pleading for itself, every soul will be paid in full for what it did, and they will not be dealt with unjustly.

112.Abdul Hye: And Allah puts forward the example of a town (Makkah) which was enjoying security and peace, its provision was coming to it in abundance from every place; then it (its people) denied the Favors of Allah. So Allah made it (its people) taste the seize of hunger and fear because of what they used to do.

113.Abdul Hye: And surely, a Messenger (Muhammad) was sent to them from among themselves, but they denied him; so the punishment overtook them while they were wrongdoers.

114.Abdul Hye: So eat of the lawful and good things which Allah has provided for you; and thank Allah’s Bounty if you really worship Him.

115.Abdul Hye: He has only forbidden you to eat the dead animal, blood, the flesh of swine, and (any animal) which is slaughtered as a sacrifice for others than Allah with it. But if one is forced (by necessity) without willful disobedience, and not transgressing, then surely, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

116.Abdul Hye: And you don’t say that which describe your tongues falsely: “This is lawful and this is unlawful,” in order to invent lies against Allah. Surely, those who invent lies against Allah will never prosper.

117.Abdul Hye: A brief enjoyment is (in this life) for them, but they will have a painful punishment.

118.Abdul Hye: And to those who are Jews, We have forbidden such things as We have already mentioned to you (Muhammad) before (6:146). And We have not wronged to them, but they did wrong to themselves.

119.Abdul Hye: Then surely, yet, your Lord is Forgiving and Merciful to those who do evil in ignorance, then they repent after that, and do righteous deeds.

120.Abdul Hye: Surely, Abraham was a nation (a leader with all the good qualities), straight obedient to Allah, and he was not of the polytheists.

121.Abdul Hye: (He was) thankful for His Graces. He chose him and guided him to the Right Way.

122.Abdul Hye: And We gave him good (life) in this world, and surely in the Hereafter he will be of those who are righteous.

123.Abdul Hye: Then, We have sent the revelation to you (O Muhammad saying): “Follow the faith of Abraham and he was not one of the polytheists.”

124.Abdul Hye: The Sabbath was only prescribed for those who differed in it. Surely, your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection about that over which they used to differ.

125.Abdul Hye: Invite (mankind, O Muhammad) to the Way of your Lord (Islam) with wisdom, kind advice, and reason with them in a way that it is better. Surely, your Lord knows best who has gone astray from His Way, and He knows best those who are guided.

126.Abdul Hye: And if you (have to) punish (your enemy), then let your punishment be like that which you were punished with. But if you endure patiently, surely, it is better for the patient.

127.Abdul Hye: And endure patiently (O Muhammad), and your patience is not but from Allah. And don’t grieve over them (polytheists), and be not in distress from what they plot.

128.Abdul Hye: Surely, Allah is with those who fear Him, and those who are righteous people

1.Abdul Hye: Glory be to He (Allah) Who took His devotee (Muhammad) for a journey by night from the sacred Masjid (at Makkah) to the farthest Masjid (Al-Aqsa at Jerusalem), which We have blessed around it (vicinity), to show him (Muhammad) some of Our signs. Surely, He is the All-Hearer, the All-Seer.

2.Abdul Hye: And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guide for the children of Israel (saying): “Don’t take other than Me as protector.

3.Abdul Hye: (You are) offspring of those whom We carried (in the ship) with Noah. Surely, he was a grateful devotee.”

4.Abdul Hye: And We decreed for the children of Israel in the Scripture: indeed you will do mischief in the earth twice, indeed you will become tyrants, and extremely arrogant!

5.Abdul Hye: When the promise for the first of the 2 came, We sent against you servants of Ours (the Assyrians) who gave a terrible warfare. They entered the very innermost parts of your homes and the promise was fulfilled.

6.Abdul Hye: Then We gave you a return of victory over them, helped you with wealth and children, and granted you more manpower.

7.Abdul Hye: (We said) if you did good, you did good for yourselves; but if you did evil, it was for your own selves. Then, when the last (2nd) promise came to pass, (We permitted your enemies – the Romans) to disgrace your faces and to enter the Masjid (of Jerusalem) just as they had entered it 1st time, and they destroyed all that they had conquered (fell in their hands) with complete destruction.

8.Abdul Hye: It may be that your Lord may show Mercy to you; but if you return (to sins), We shall return (to Our Punishment). And Allah has made hell a prison for the disbelievers.

9.Abdul Hye: Surely, this Qur’an guides to the way which is just perfect and gives the glad tidings to the believers who do righteous deeds so that they shall have a great reward;

10.Abdul Hye: and those who don’t believe in the Hereafter; We have prepared for them a painful punishment.

11.Abdul Hye: And mankind invokes (Allah) for evil as mankind invokes (Allah) for good, and mankind is ever hasty.

12.Abdul Hye: And We have made the night and the day as 2 signs. Then, We have covered the night with darkness and have given light to the day so that you may seek Bounty from your Lord, and that you may compute number of the years and the reckoning. Thus We have explained everything with full explanation.

13.Abdul Hye: And We have fastened the deeds of every human in its neck, and on the Day of Resurrection We shall bring out for him a book which will be wide open.

14.Abdul Hye: (It will be said): “Read your book. You yourself are sufficient today as a reckoner (accountant) against you.”

15.Abdul Hye: Whoever goes right, then it goes right only for its own self. Whoever goes astray, then it goes astray only against its own self. No one shall bear the burden of another (on the Day of Judgment). And We don’t punish (in this world) until We have sent a Messenger.

16.Abdul Hye: And when We decide to destroy a town, We first send commandments to its wealthy luxurious people, but they transgress in it. Thus the word (of punishment) is justified against it. Then We destroy it with complete destruction.

17.Abdul Hye: And how many generations We have destroyed since after Noah? Your Lord is Sufficient as an All-Knower and All-Seer of the sins of His servants.

18.Abdul Hye: Whoever wishes for the quick-passing (enjoyment of this world), We quickly grant it to whoever He wills. Then, We condemn him to hell who will burn therein disgraced and rejected

19.Abdul Hye: And whoever desires the Hereafter and strives for it with its striving while he is a believer, then they are such that their striving will be appreciated.

20.Abdul Hye: We provide each of these and those from the Bounties of your Lord. The Bounties of your Lord can never be forbidden.

21.Abdul Hye: See how We prefer some of them over others and surely, the Hereafter will be greater in degrees and greater in preference.

22.Abdul Hye: Don’t set up another one worthy of worship with Allah, lest you sit down condemned, forsaken.

23.Abdul Hye: And your Lord has decreed that you worship none except Him. You shall be good (dutiful) to parents. If one of them or both of them attain old age with you, then don’t say to them a word of disrespect, nor scold them but address them in terms of honor.

24.Abdul Hye: And lower to them the wing of submission (humility) through Mercy, and say: “My Lord! Bestow on them Your Mercy just as they raised me (when I was) a little child.”

25.Abdul Hye: Your Lord knows best what is in your hearts. If you are righteous, then surely, He is forgiving to those who often turn (to Him).

26.Abdul Hye: Give to your relatives their due and to the poor, and to the wayfarers. But don’t spend wastefully (your wealth like a spendthrift),

27.Abdul Hye: surely, the spendthrifts are brothers of the devils, and the devil is ever ungrateful to its Lord.

28.Abdul Hye: And if you (O Muhammad) turn away from them (kinsman, poor, wayfarer, etc) seeking a Mercy from your Lord which you hope, then say kind word to them.

29.Abdul Hye: And you shall neither tie your hands (like a miser) to your neck nor stretch them to their utmost reach, so that you become blameworthy, and in severe poverty.

30.Abdul Hye: Surely, your Lord extends the provision to whom He wills and straitens (for whom He wills). Surely, He is All-Knower, All-Seer of His servants.

31.Abdul Hye: And don’t kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide (sustenance) for them and for you. Surely, killing them is a great sin.

32.Abdul Hye: Don’t approach adultery. Surely, it is a great sin, and it is the worst way.

33.Abdul Hye: Don’t kill a soul which Allah has forbidden, except for a just cause. And whoever is killed wrongfully, and then surely We have made for its heir (guardian) an authority. But let him not exceed limits in killing (should not kill except the killer only). Surely, he is helped (by Islamic law).

34.Abdul Hye: And don’t go near the property of the orphan except with what is best (to improve), until it attains the age of full strength. Fulfill the covenant. Surely! The covenant is a responsibility (will be questioned).

35.Abdul Hye: And give full measure when you measure, and weigh with a straight balance. That is good and better interpretation (in the end).

36.Abdul Hye: And don’t follow (anyone blindly in matters) about which you don’t have knowledge. Surely, the (use of) hearing, the sight, and the heart - for each of these, you will be questioned (by Allah on the Day of Judgment).

37.Abdul Hye: And don’t walk on the earth with arrogance. Surely, you can neither penetrate the earth nor can attain the height of the mountains.

38.Abdul Hye: All that is evil are hateful to your Lord.

39.Abdul Hye: This is part of wisdom which your Lord has revealed to you (Muhammad). Don’t set up with Allah another one worthy of worship lest you should be thrown into hell, blameworthy and rejected.

40.Abdul Hye: Has your Lord preferred for you (O pagans of Makkah) to give sons and adapted (for Himself) from among the angels as females (daughters)? Surely! You utter awful statement.

41.Abdul Hye: And surely, We have explained in this Qur’an so that they (disbelievers) may take heed, but it has only increased their dislike.

42.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad to polytheists): “If there were other one worthy of worship besides Him as they say, they would have certainly sought a way to (dethrone) the Master of the Throne.

43.Abdul Hye: Glorified and exalted is He! (He) is far above (the great falsehood) that they say!

44.Abdul Hye: The 7 heavens, the earth, and all that is in them glorify Him. There is not a single thing but glorifies Him with praise. But you don’t understand their glorification. Surely, He is Forbearing, Forgiving.

45.Abdul Hye: And when you (Muhammad) recite the Qur’an, We make an invisible veil (unseen barrier) between you and between those who don’t believe in the Hereafter.

46.Abdul Hye: And We put coverings over their hearts so that they don’t understand it (the Qur’an), and create deafness in their ears. When you mention of your Lord alone in the Qur’an, they turn their backs in extreme dislike.

47.Abdul Hye: We know best what they like to listen when they listen to you. When they take secret counsel, then the wrongdoers say: “You follow none but a bewitched man.”

48.Abdul Hye: See how they have put forward examples for you. They have gone astray, and they can not find a way.

49.Abdul Hye: And they say: “When we are reduced to bones and fragments (ashes), shall we really be resurrected to a new creation?”

50.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad):“(You will be brought back to life) even if you be stones or iron,

51.Abdul Hye: or even a creation that is greater (or harder) than you may think of.” Then they will ask: “Who will return us (back to life)?” Say: “He Who created you first time.” Then they will shake their heads at you and ask: “When it will be?” Say: “Perhaps it is near (soon)!”

52.Abdul Hye: On the Day when He will call you, you will answer with His Praise, and you will think that you have stayed (in death) but a little while!

53.Abdul Hye: And say to My servants (true believers) that they should only say those words that are the best. Surely, Satan sows (disagreements) among them. Surely, Satan is a plain enemy to mankind.

54.Abdul Hye: Your Lord knows you best. If He wills, He will have Mercy on you, or if He wills, He will punish you. And We have not sent you (Muhammad) as a guardian over them.

55.Abdul Hye: And your Lord knows best all those that are in the heavens and the earth. Indeed, We have preferred some of the prophets above others, and We gave the Psalms to David.

56.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “Call to those whom you pretend (to be worthy of worship) besides Him. They have neither the power to remove the hardship from you nor even to change it.”

57.Abdul Hye: Those to whom they pray, desire the means of access to their Lord, which of them should be the nearest, and they hope for His Mercy and fear Hiss punishment. Surely, the punishment of your Lord is (something to be) afraid of.

58.Abdul Hye: There is not a town but We shall destroy it before the Day of Resurrection, or punish it with severe punishment. That is written in the book (of records).

59.Abdul Hye: And nothing stops Us to send the signs but that the people of old denied them. And We sent the she-camel to Thamud as a clear sign, but they did her wrong. And We don’t send the signs except to warn.

60.Abdul Hye: And (remember) when We said to you (O Muhammad): “Surely! Your Lord has encompassed mankind.” And We have not make the vision (Al-Isra) which We showed you (O Muhammad on the night of Al-Isra) but a trial for mankind, and likewise the accursed tree (Zaqqoom) in the Qur’an. We warn them but it does not increase (fear in) them except great disbelief, oppression and disobedience.

61.Abdul Hye: And (remember) when We said to the angels: “Prostrate unto Adam.” They prostrated except Satan. He said: “Shall I prostrate to one whom You have created (from) clay?”

62.Abdul Hye: (Satan) said: “Is this the one whom You have honored above me? If You give me respite (keep alive) to the Day of Resurrection, I will surely seize and mislead his (Adam’s) offspring (sending them astray) all but a few!”

63.Abdul Hye: (Allah) said: “Go, and whoever of them follows you, then surely, hell will be the recompense of all of you, an ample recompense.

64.Abdul Hye: And befool whom you can of them with your voice, and make assaults on them with your cavalry and your infantry, and share with them in wealth and children, and promise them. But Satan promises them nothing but deception.

65.Abdul Hye: Surely! My servants, there is no authority for you over them. Your Lord is All-Sufficient as a Guardian.”

66.Abdul Hye: Your Lord is the one who drives your ships in the sea in order that you may seek His Bounty. Surely! He is Merciful towards you.

67.Abdul Hye: And whenever any harm touches you at the sea, all those to whom you call upon except Him (Allah) vanish. Yet, when He brings you safely to the land, you turn away (from Him). And human is ever ungrateful.

68.Abdul Hye: Do you then feel secure that He will not cause side of the land to swallow you up, or send against you a violent sand-storm? Then, you shall not find a guardian for you.

69.Abdul Hye: Or do you feel secure that when you will return to it (sea) a 2nd time, He will not send a hurricane of wind against you and drown you because of your disbelief? (If that happens) then you will not find for you therein an avenger (to take revenge) against Us.

70.Abdul Hye: And indeed, We have honored the children of Adam, We have carried them on land and sea, have provided them with good things, and have preferred them over many of those whom We have created with a marked preference.

71.Abdul Hye: (Remember) the Day when We shall call all human beings with their leaders. Those who will be given their book (of records) in their right hand will read their records and will not be dealt unjustly in the least.

72.Abdul Hye: But those who are blind (acted) in this world will be blind in the Hereafter and more astray from the way.

73.Abdul Hye: Surely, they were about to tempt you (O Muhammad) away from that which We have revealed (the Qur’an) to you, to fabricate something other than it against Us, and (if successful) then they would have certainly taken you a friend!

74.Abdul Hye: And had We not made you stand firm, surely you would nearly have inclined to (compromise with) them a little bit.

75.Abdul Hye: Then We would have made you taste a double punishment in this life and a double punishment after death. Then you would not have found anyone to help you against Us.

76.Abdul Hye: And surely, they were about to frighten you so that they might drive you out from the land. But then they would not have stayed after you, except a little while.

77.Abdul Hye: (This was Our) way with whom indeed We sent Messengers before you (O Muhammad), and you will not find any alteration in Our Way.

78.Abdul Hye: Establish prayer from mid-day till the darkness of the night (Zuhr, Asr, Maghrib, and Isha prayers), and (recite the) Qur’an in the early dawn (the morning prayer- Fajr). Surely, the recitation of the Qur’an in the early dawn is witnessed (by angels).

79.Abdul Hye: And in (some parts of) the night perform the night prayer with it (recite the Qur’an) as an additional prayer (Tahajjud) for you (O Muhammad). It may be that your Lord will raise you to ‘Maqam-e-Mahmood’ (a station of praise-worthy on the Day of Resurrection).

80.Abdul Hye: And say (O Muhammad): “My Lord! Make me enter (the city of Madinah) one entry in truth, and bring me out (from the city of Makkah) one exit in truth. And grant me from You an authority helper,”

81.Abdul Hye: and say: “Truth has come and the falsehood has vanished. Surely! Falsehood is bound to vanish.”

82.Abdul Hye: And We have sent down the Qur’an which is a healing and a Mercy to the believers, while it increases nothing but loss to the wrongdoers.

83.Abdul Hye: And when We bestow Our Grace on mankind, it turns away and becomes far away at one side (from the Right Way). When evil touches, it is in great despair.

84.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad to mankind): “Everyone acts according to its manner; but your Lord knows best whose way (religion) is best guided.”

85.Abdul Hye: And they ask you (O Muhammad) about the soul (spirit). Say: “The soul is one of the commands of my Lord and you have not been given the knowledge of it but a little.”

86.Abdul Hye: And if We willed, We could surely take away all that which We have revealed to you (this Qur’an). Then you would find no protector for you against Us (to get it back),

87.Abdul Hye: except as a Mercy from your Lord. Surely! His Grace to you (O Muhammad) is great indeed.

88.Abdul Hye: Say: “If the mankind and the jinns together were to bring the like of this Qur’an, they could not bring the like thereof, even if some of them was helper to some others.”

89.Abdul Hye: And indeed We have fully explained to mankind in this Qur’an every kind of similitude, but most people refuse but disbelief.

90.Abdul Hye: And they say: “We shall not believe in you (O Muhammad) until you cause a spring to gush forth from the earth for us,

91.Abdul Hye: or there is a garden of date-palms and grapes for you and cause rivers to gush forth in their midst abundantly;

92.Abdul Hye: or you cause to fall the heaven upon us in pieces as you have claimed, or you bring Allah and the angels (face to face) before us,

93.Abdul Hye: or there is a house of adorable materials (like silver and gold) for you, or you ascend up into the sky, and we shall not believe in your ascension until you bring down for us a book that we would read.” Say (O Muhammad): “Glory be to my Lord! Am I (claimed) anything more but a human, sent as a Messenger?”

94.Abdul Hye: And nothing prevented people from belief when the guidance came to them except that they said: “Has Allah sent a human as (His) Messenger?”

95.Abdul Hye: Say: “If there were angels walking on the earth in peace, then We would certainly have sent down to them an angel from the heaven as a Messenger.”

96.Abdul Hye: Say: “Allah is sufficient as a witness between me and between you. Surely! He is All-Knower, the All-Seer of His servants.”

97.Abdul Hye: And those whom Allah guides are rightly guided; but those whom He sends astray, they will never find protectors for them besides Him. We shall gather them on the Day of Resurrection on their faces, blind, dumb and deaf. Their abode will be hell; whenever its flame abates, We shall increase the fierceness of fire for them.

98.Abdul Hye: That is their recompense because they denied Our Verses and they said: “When we are reduced to bones and fragments, shall we really be resurrected as new creation?”

99.Abdul Hye: They don’t see that Allah, who has created the heavens and the earth, is able to create the people like them. He has made for them an appointed term; there is no doubt in it. But the wrongdoers refuse but disbelief.

100.Abdul Hye: Say (to the disbelievers): “Even if you possessed all the treasures of the Mercy of my Lord, you would surely hold them back for fear of spending. Human is ever miserly!”

101.Abdul Hye: And indeed We gave to Moses 9 clear signs. Ask the children of Israel, when he came to them, then Pharaoh said to him: “O Moses! I think you are indeed bewitched.”

102.Abdul Hye: (Moses) replied: “Surely, you know that no one has sent down these signs but the Lord of the heavens and the earth as clear signs. Surely O Pharaoh, I think you are doomed to destruction.”

103.Abdul Hye: So he (Pharaoh) wanted to turn them out of the land (of Egypt). But We drowned him and all who were with him.

104.Abdul Hye: And We said to the children of Israel after him: “You reside in the land and then when the last promise comes, We shall assemble you as a mixed crowd.”

105.Abdul Hye: And We have sent it (the Qur’an) down with truth and with truth it has descended. And We have not sent you (O Muhammad) except as a bearer of glad-tidings and a Warner.

106.Abdul Hye: And We have divided the Qur’an (into parts) so that you may recite it to people at intervals. And We have revealed it by stages (in 23 years).

107.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad to them): “Whether you believe in it (the Qur’an) or don’t believe, surely those who were given knowledge before it (Jews and Christians like Abdullah bin Salam and Salman Al-Farsi), they fall down on their faces in prostration when it is recited to them,

108.Abdul Hye: and they say: ‘Glory be to our Lord! Surely, the Promise of our Lord must be fulfilled.’

109.Abdul Hye: And they fall down on their faces, weeping and it increases their humility.”

110.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “Invoke Allah or invoke the Beneficent, by whatever name you invoke Him, to Him belongs the best names. Offer your prayer neither aloud nor make it in a low voice but seek a way between these

111.Abdul Hye: and say: “Praise be to Allah, Who has not taken a son, and Who has no partner in (His) Dominion, nor there is any protector for Him out of dependence. And magnify Him with all magnificence.

1.Abdul Hye: All the praises be to Allah Who has sent down to His servant (Muhammad) the book (the Qur’an) and has not placed therein any crookedness.

2.Abdul Hye: (He has made it) right to give warning (to the disbelievers) of a severe punishment from Him, and to give glad tidings to the believers who work righteous deeds so that they shall have a good reward (Paradise),

3.Abdul Hye: (they shall) abide in it forever.

4.Abdul Hye: Also to warn those who say: “Allah has begotten a son.”

5.Abdul Hye: They don’t have knowledge about it, nor did their forefathers. Mighty is the word that comes out of their mouths. They say nothing but a lie.

6.Abdul Hye: Perhaps, you would kill yourself (O Muhammad) in grief over their footsteps, because they don’t believe in this narration (the Qur’an).

7.Abdul Hye: Surely! We have made the earth with all kinds of adornments in order that We may test them (mankind) and to see which of them are best in deeds.

8.Abdul Hye: And surely We shall reduce what is on it (the earth) to a bare dry soil.

9.Abdul Hye: Do you think that the people of the cave and the inscription (news or name writing of the people of the cave) were a wonder among Our Signs?

10.Abdul Hye: (Remember) when the young men fled (for refuge from their disbelieving folk) to the cave, they said: “Our Lord! Bestow on us Mercy from You and facilitate for us in our affair to the Right Way!”

11.Abdul Hye: Therefore We covered on their ears (causing them into deep sleep) in the cave for a number of years,

12.Abdul Hye: then We raised them up (from sleep) so that We might test which of the 2 parties (believers and disbelievers) was best at calculating the time period for which they had stayed.

13.Abdul Hye: We narrate to you (O Muhammad) their story with truth. Surely they were young men who believed in their Lord and We increased them in guidance.

14.Abdul Hye: And We made their hearts firm and strong when they stood up and said: “Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, we shall never call upon any deity other than Him; for if we do, then we shall utter something improper (in disbelief).

15.Abdul Hye: These are our people who have taken for deities other than Him (Allah). Why do they not bring for them a clear authority? And who does more wrong than the one who invents a lie against Allah?”

16.Abdul Hye: (They consulted with one another and said): “Now we have withdrawn from them and denounced those deities whom they worship except Allah, then seek refuge in the cave; our Lord will open a way for us from His Mercy and will make easy for us in our affair.”

17.Abdul Hye: And you might have seen the sun when it rose, it declines to the right from their cave; and when it set, it turns away from them towards the left while they lay in the middle of the cave. That is one of the signs of Allah. Whoever He guides is rightly guided; but whoever He sends astray, you will never find guiding friend (to lead to the Right Way) for him.

18.Abdul Hye: And you would have thought them awake, though they were asleep. And We turned them to the right and to the left sides, while their dog stretched out its 2 forelegs at the entrance (of the cave). Had you looked at them, you would have certainly turned back from them in flight and (their sight) certainly would have filled with awe of them.

19.Abdul Hye: Thus, We awakened them (from long deep sleep) so that they could question among them. A speaker from them said: “How long have you stayed here?” They said: “Perhaps we have stayed here for a day or part of a day.” They said: “Our Lord knows best how long we have stayed here. So send one of us with our silver coin to the city, and let him find out which is the purest food, and let him bring us some of it. Let him be careful and don’t let anyone know our whereabouts.

20.Abdul Hye: Surely if they learn about you, they will stone you (to death), or turn you back into their religion, and in that case you will never ever be successful.”

21.Abdul Hye: And thus We made their case known so that people might know that the Promise of Allah is true and that there is no doubt about the Hour (of Judgment). (Remember) when they (the people of the city) disputed among themselves about their case, they said: “Construct a building over them, their Lord knows best about them.” Those who won on their point said: “Surely we shall build a place of worship over them.”

22.Abdul Hye: Some say they were 3 and their dog was the 4th of them. Others say they were 5 and their dog was the 6th of them guessing at the unseen. Yet, others say they were 7 and their dog was the 8th of them. Say (O Muhammad): “My Lord knows best their number. None knows them but a few.” So don’t debate about them except with clear proof and don’t consult about them (people of Cave) with anyone.

23.Abdul Hye: And never say of anything: “Surely I shall do that tomorrow,”

24.Abdul Hye: except that (say): “If Allah wills!” And remember your Lord when you forget and say: “I hope that my Lord will guide me to a closer way of guidance than this.”

25.Abdul Hye: And (some say) they stayed in their cave 300 years (solar) and add 9 (lunar years).

26.Abdul Hye: (O Muhammad) say: “Allah knows best how long they stayed. With Him is (the knowledge of) the unseen of the heavens and the earth. How clearly He sees with it and how clearly He hears! They did not have any helper other than Him, and He does not share in His Decision and rule with anyone.”

27.Abdul Hye: And recite what has been revealed to you (O Muhammad) from the book (the Qur’an) of your Lord. None can change His Words and you will never find a refuge other than Him.

28.Abdul Hye: Keep yourself (O Muhammad) patiently with those who call their Lord in the morning and the evening seeking His pleasure, and don’t let your eyes overlook them desiring the beauty of the life of the world; don’t obey the one whose heart We have made heedless of Our remembrance, who follows own lusts and whose affair has been lost.

29.Abdul Hye: (O Muhammad) say: “The truth is from your Lord. Whoever wills let him believe, and whoever wills, let him disbelieve.” Surely, We have prepared a fire for the wrongdoers; its walls will surround them (disbelievers). If they ask for help, they will be granted water like boiling oil that will burn faces. Terrible is the drink and evil is the resting place!

30.Abdul Hye: Surely! Those who believe and do righteous deeds, We shall not lose the reward of him who does good deeds.

31.Abdul Hye: Those are the ones for them there will be gardens of Eden; rivers flow beneath them; they will be decorated therein with bracelets of gold, and they will wear green garments of fine and thick silk. They will recline therein on raised thrones. How good is the reward, and how excellent is the resting place!

32.Abdul Hye: And (O Muhammad) put forward to them the example of 2 men: We had given 2 gardens of grapes to one of them, We had surrounded them with date-palms, and had made cultivated fields between them.

33.Abdul Hye: Both the gardens brought forth their produce and did not fail in the least. We (even) caused a river to gush forth in the middle of them.

34.Abdul Hye: And there was abundant produce for him and he said to his companion while he was talking to him: “I have more wealth than you and stronger (in respect of) men.”

35.Abdul Hye: And he entered his garden while he was unjust to himself. He said: “I don’t think that this garden will ever perish!

36.Abdul Hye: And I don’t think the Hour will ever come. Even if I am brought back to my Lord, surely I shall find better than this at the end.”

37.Abdul Hye: His companion said to him while he was talking to him: “Do you disbelieve in Him Who created you out of dust, then out of semen, then fashioned you into a man?

38.Abdul Hye: He is my Lord and I shall not associate anyone with my Lord.

39.Abdul Hye: When you entered your garden, why did you not say: ‘It is as Allah wills! There is no power but with Allah!’ If you see me, I have less wealth than you and children,

40.Abdul Hye: it may be that my Lord will give me something better than your garden, and may send a punishment from the sky on it, then turn it into a slippery earth.

41.Abdul Hye: Or its water will become deep-sunken (dry underground) so that you will never be able to find it.”

42.Abdul Hye: (It so happened that) his fruits were surrounded (with ruin). He began twisting his hands (with sorrow) over what he had spent on it while all (fruits) were destroyed on their nets, and he said: “I wish I had not associated anyone with my Lord!”

43.Abdul Hye: And he could neither find anyone to help him other than Allah, nor could he defend himself.

44.Abdul Hye: The real power (protection) comes from Allah, the true one worthy of worship. He (Allah) is the best for reward and the best for the final end

45.Abdul Hye: And (O Muhammad) put forward for them the example of the worldly life. It is like water (rain) which We send down from the sky and the vegetation of the earth mingles with it. (But later it) becomes dry stalks which the winds scatter. And Allah has power over everything.

46.Abdul Hye: Wealth and children are the adornment of the worldly life. But the lasting righteous deeds are better with your Lord for rewards and better hope.

47.Abdul Hye: And (remember) the Day when We shall cause the mountains to move, you will see the earth as a leveled plain (of waste), We shall gather them, and will not leave anyone of them behind.

48.Abdul Hye: And they will be set before your Lord in rows (and Allah will say): “Now indeed you have come to Us as We created you the first time. Nay, but you thought that We had never appointed a meeting for you.”

49.Abdul Hye: And the book (one’s record) will be placed (before them), and you will see the sinners fearful of what is (recorded) in it. They will say: “Woe to us! What is the matter with this book? Neither it leaves out a small thing nor a big thing but has recorded it with numbers!” They will find all that they did and placed before them. Your Lord will not treat anyone with injustice.

50.Abdul Hye: And (remember) when We said to the angels: “Prostrate to Adam,” all prostrated except Satan. He was one of the jinns; he disobeyed the command of its Lord. Will you then take him (Satan) and its progeny as your protectors rather than Me while they are enemies to you? What an evil is the exchange for the wrongdoers!

51.Abdul Hye: (Allah) did not make them (Satan and its offspring) to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor their own creation, nor I (Allah) took the misleaders (of mankind) as helpers.

52.Abdul Hye: And (remember) the Day when He will say: “Call those partners of Mine whom you claimed.” They will cry to them but they will not answer them and We shall put a barrier between them.

53.Abdul Hye: And the sinners will see the fire and realize that they have to fall therein. And they will not find a way of escape from it.

54.Abdul Hye: And indeed We explained every example in this Qur’an for mankind (to understand). But human is quarrelsome of most things.

55.Abdul Hye: And nothing prevents mankind from believing and asking forgiveness of their Lord when the guidance (the Qur’an) has come to them, except that the way of the ancients come upon them or the punishment come upon them face to face.

56.Abdul Hye: We sent the Messengers except as bearers of glad tidings and warners. But the disbelievers disputed with false argument in order to refute the truth. They took My Verses with which they were warned, as a joke!

57.Abdul Hye: And who is more unjust than the one who, when reminded of the Verses of the Lord, turns away from them and forgets what deeds its own hands have done? (For these people) surely, We have set veils over their hearts so they don’t understand it (the Qur’an), and their ears are (covered) with deafness. If you (O Muhammad) call them to the guidance, even then they will never be guided.

58.Abdul Hye: And your Lord is Forgiving, the Owner of Mercy. If He calls them to account for what they have earned, He would have hastened the punishment for them. But they have their appointed time, beyond which they will never find an escape.

59.Abdul Hye: And We destroyed these towns with them (Ad, Thamud inhabitants) when they did wrong. We appointed a fixed time for their destruction.

60.Abdul Hye: And (remember) when Moses said to his young servant: “I will not give up (traveling) until I reach the junction of the 2 seas or (until) I spend years (in traveling).”

61.Abdul Hye: But when they reached the junction between them, they forgot (about) their fish (they were carrying), which made its way through the sea as in a tunnel.

62.Abdul Hye: So when they had passed further on, he (Moses) said to his young servant: “Bring us our breakfast; truly we have suffered this fatigue in our journey.”

63.Abdul Hye: He replied: “Do you remember when we were resting ourselves beside the rock? Indeed I forgot the fish, none but Satan made me forget to remember it. It took its way into the sea in a strange way!”

64.Abdul Hye: (Moses) said: “That is what we have been seeking.” So they went back retracing their footsteps.

65.Abdul Hye: Then they found one of Our servant (Khidr) whom We had bestowed Mercy from Us, and We had taught him knowledge from Us.

66.Abdul Hye: Moses requested him: “May I follow you so that you may teach me something of that knowledge which you have been taught (by Allah)?

67.Abdul Hye: He (Khidr) said: “Surely! You will never be able to have patience with me,

68.Abdul Hye: how can you have patience about that which is beyond your knowledge?”

69.Abdul Hye: (Moses) said: “You will find me patient if Allah wills, and I will not disobey your command.”

70.Abdul Hye: He (Khidr) said: “Then, if you follow me, don’t ask me about anything until I myself mention it to you.”

71.Abdul Hye: So they both proceeded, till when they embarked in a ship, Khidr made a hole in it. Moses said: “Have you made a hole in it to drown its people? Surely, you have done a bad thing.”

72.Abdul Hye: He (Khidr) said: “Did I not tell you that you would never be able to have patience with me?”

73.Abdul Hye: (Moses) said: “Don’t call me to account for what I forgot, and don’t be hard on me for my affair (with you).”

74.Abdul Hye: Then they both proceeded till they met a boy, then Khidr killed him. Moses said: “Have you killed an innocent person who killed none? Surely, you have committed an evil thing!”

75.Abdul Hye: (Khidr) said: “Did I not tell you that you would never be able to have patience with me?”

76.Abdul Hye: (Moses) said: “If I ever ask you about anything after this, don’t keep me in your company, (If I ask again then) surely you will have an excuse in my case.”

77.Abdul Hye: Then they both proceeded, till they came to the people of a town. They asked its people for food, but they refused to entertain them. Then they found in it a wall that was about to collapse, so Khidr set it up straight. Moses said: “If you had wished, surely you could have taken some wages for it!”

78.Abdul Hye: (Khidr) said: “This is the parting (time) between me and you. (First) I will tell you the interpretation of those (acts) over which you could not have patience.

79.Abdul Hye: As for the ship, it belonged to poor people working in the sea. I intended to damage it as there was a king after them who was seizing every ship by force.

80.Abdul Hye: As for the boy, his parents were believers, and we feared lest he would oppress them by rebellion and disbelief.

81.Abdul Hye: So we intended that their Lord should exchange for them one (son) better than him in righteousness and near to mercy.

82.Abdul Hye: As for the wall, it belonged to 2 orphan boys in the town and there was a treasure for them under it. Since their father was a righteous man, your Lord intended that they should attain their age of full strength and then take out their treasure as a Mercy from your Lord. I did not do them by my own will. That is the interpretation of (those actions) over which you could not hold patience.”

83.Abdul Hye: And (O Muhammad) they ask you about Dhul-Qarnain. Say: “I shall recite to you something of him.”

84.Abdul Hye: Surely, We established him in the earth and gave him means of everything.

85.Abdul Hye: So he followed a way (towards the west)

86.Abdul Hye: until, when he reached the setting place of the sun, he found it setting in a spring of black muddy water. He found a people near it. We said: “O Dhul-Qarnain! Either you punish them, or treat them with kindness.”

87.Abdul Hye: He said (to people): “Whoever will do wrong, we shall punish him; then he will be brought back to the Lord, who will punish with a terrible punishment.

88.Abdul Hye: As for him who believes and does righteous deeds, he shall have the best reward (Paradise), and we (Dhul-Qarnain) shall speak to him with mild words.”

89.Abdul Hye: Then he followed another way (towards the east)

90.Abdul Hye: until, when he reached the rising place of the sun, he found it rising on a people for whom We had not provided any shelter against it (the sun).

91.Abdul Hye: (He left them) as it was! And We knew whatever information was with him (Dhul-Qarnain).

92.Abdul Hye: Then he followed (another) way

93.Abdul Hye: until, when he reached between 2 mountains where he found (near) them a people who almost did not understood a word.

94.Abdul Hye: They said: “O Dhul-Qarnain! Surely! (The people of) Gog and Magog are doing mischief in the land. Shall we pay to you a tribute in order that you make a barrier between us and them?”

95.Abdul Hye: He said: “What my Lord has granted me is better (than your tribute). Just help me with strength (manpower) and I will erect a barrier between you and them.

96.Abdul Hye: Give me pieces (blocks) of iron.”  Until when he leveled the gap between the 2 mountain-cliffs, he said: “Blow,” until when he had made it (red iron) fire, he said: “Bring me molten copper to pour over it.”

97.Abdul Hye: So they (Gog and Magog) could not scale it nor could they dig through.

98.Abdul Hye: (Dhul-Qarnain) said: “This is a Mercy from my Lord. But when the Promise of my Lord will come, He shall make it flat (leveled). Promise of my Lord is true.”

99.Abdul Hye: And that Day (when Gog and Magog will come out), We shall leave some of people to surge like waves on others. The trumpet will be blown and We shall collect them (the creatures) all together.

100.Abdul Hye: On that Day We shall present hell to the disbelievers with plain view,

68.Abdul Hye: By your Lord, surely We shall gather them together and the devils, then We shall bring them round hell on knees

70.Abdul Hye: Then, surely We know best those who deserve to be burnt in it.

71.Abdul Hye: There is not one of you, who will not pass over it (hell); this is a Decree with your Lord,

1.Abdul Hye: Ta-Ha.

5.Abdul Hye: the Gracious (Allah) rose over the Throne (to suit Majesty),

28.Abdul Hye: so that they understand my speec

29.Abdul Hye: and appoint for me a helper from my family;

30.Abdul Hye: Aaron, my brother.

31.Abdul Hye: Increase my strength with him

32.Abdul Hye: and share him in my task,

35.Abdul Hye: surely! You see well all of us.”

62.Abdul Hye: Then they debated with one another their matter among them, and they kept their talk secret.

100.Abdul Hye: Whoever turns away from it (this Qur’an), then surely will bear a burden (of sins) on the Day of Resurrection.
