4.Abdul Hye: Allah has not put 2 hearts in one person’s body. Neither has He made your wives whom you declare (divorce) through Zihar to be like your mother’s backs, (Zihar is the saying of a husband to his wife: "you are to me like the back of my mother" i.e. you are unlawful for me to approach, deprive her rights and keep her like a captive and don’t let her marry anyone else) as your real mothers, nor has He made your adopted sons your real sons. That is your saying with your mouths. But Allah says the truth, and He guides to the Right Way.

5.Abdul Hye: Call them (adopted sons) by (the names of) their fathers, that is more just with Allah. But if you don’t know their fathers, (call them) your brothers in the religion and your friends. There is no sin on you if you make a mistake in it, except what your hearts deliberately intend. And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

6.Abdul Hye: The Prophet is closer to the believers than their own selves, and his wives are their (believers’) mothers. Those who are blood relations, some of them are closer to each other in the Decree of Allah (regarding inheritance) than (the brotherhood of) the believers and the emigrants (from Makkah to Madinah), except that you do kindness to your brothers. This has been written in the book (of divine Decrees).

7.Abdul Hye: And (remember) when We took the covenant from the prophets, from you (O Muhammad), from Noah, Abraham, Moses, and Jesus, son of Mary. We took from them a strong covenant,

8.Abdul Hye: so that He may ask the truthful (Messengers) about their truth. And He has prepared a painful punishment for the disbelievers.

9.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Remember the Favor of Allah to you, when hosts (enemy) came against you and We sent winds and forces (invisible angels) against them that you did not see (during the battle of Trench). And Allah is All-Seer of what you do.

10.Abdul Hye: When they (enemy) came upon you from above and from below; when the eyes grew wild and the hearts reached the throats, and you were entertaining all doubts about Allah,

11.Abdul Hye: there, the believers were tested and shaken with a mighty shake.

12.Abdul Hye: And when the hypocrites and those in whose hearts there was a disease (doubt) said: “Allah and His Messenger promised us nothing but delusion (deception)!”

13.Abdul Hye: And a party of them said: “O people of Madinah! There is no stand for you (against the enemy attack!). Therefore go back!” Another band of them asked permission of the prophet saying: “Truly, our homes lie open (to the enemy),” they were not secure. They wished nothing but to flee (from battle).

14.Abdul Hye: And if (the enemy) had entered on them from all its (the city) sides and they had been exhorted to trial (renegade from Islam to polytheism), they would have committed it and would not have little hesitation in it.

15.Abdul Hye: And indeed they had already made a covenant with Allah not to turn their backs, and a covenant with Allah must be answered for.

16.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad to these hypocrites who ask your permission to run away from you): “Flight (run away) will not avail you if you flee from death or killing, and you will enjoy a little (while in this world)!”

17.Abdul Hye: Say: “Who can protect you from Allah if He intends to harm you, or intends to show you Mercy?” They will not find for themselves other than Allah, a protector or a helper.

18.Abdul Hye: Allah already knows those from among you who keep back (people) from fighting (in Allah’s cause), and those who say to their brothers: “Come here towards us,” while they (themselves) don’t come to the battle except a few,

19.Abdul Hye: they are miserly towards you (to help in Allah’s cause). When fear comes (to them), you will see them looking to you, revolving their eyes as if their deaths hover over them, but when the fear departs, they will smite you with sharp tongues, become miserly towards (spending on) good. Such people have not believed. Therefore Allah makes their deeds fruitless, and that is very easy for Allah.

20.Abdul Hye: They thought that the confederates would not withdraw. If the confederates should come again, they would wish if they were in the deserts (wandering) among the Bedouins and ask about your news (from a safe distance); and if they happen to be among you, they would not fight but a little.

21.Abdul Hye: Indeed, you have in the Messenger of Allah (Muhammad) the ‘best example’ (to follow) for those who hope to (meet with) Allah, the Last Day, and remember Allah much.

22.Abdul Hye: And when the believers saw the confederates, they said: “This is what Allah and His Messenger (Muhammad) had promised us, and Allah and His Messenger (Muhammad) had spoken the truth.” It increased them in faith and obedience (to Allah).

23.Abdul Hye: Among the believers there are people who have been true to their covenant with Allah, some of them have fulfilled their obligations (sacrificed their lives), and some of them are still waiting, but they have never changed (their covenant) in the least.

24.Abdul Hye: Allah may reward the people of truth for their truth, and punish the hypocrites if He wills or forgive them. Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

25.Abdul Hye: And Allah drove back those who disbelieved in their rage; they did not gain any advantage. Allah is sufficient for the believers in the fighting. And Allah is All-Strong, All-Mighty.

26.Abdul Hye: Those people of the Scripture (Jews of Bani Quraizah) who backed them (the invaders); Allah brought them down from their forts and cast fear into their hearts. So a group you killed and a group you made captives.

27.Abdul Hye: And thus He made you to inherit their lands, their houses, their riches, and the land (Khaibar) which you had not frequented (before). Allah is Able to do all things.

28.Abdul Hye: O Prophet (Muhammad)! Say to your wives: “If you desire the worldly life and its glitter, then come, I shall make you a provision and set you free (divorce) in an honorable way.”

29.Abdul Hye: But if you desire Allah and His Messenger, and the home of the Hereafter; then surely, Allah has prepared a great reward for the righteous people amongst you.

30.Abdul Hye: O wives of the prophet! Whoever of you commits an open illegal sexual intercourse, her punishment will be doubled and that is easy for Allah.

31.Abdul Hye: Whoever of you (wives of the Prophet) is obedient to Allah and His Messenger, and does righteous deeds, We shall grant her double reward, and We have prepared a noble provision for her.

32.Abdul Hye: O wives of the prophet! You are not like any other women. If you fear Allah, then don’t be soft in speech (to men not related), lest the one in whose heart there is a disease (of hypocrisy, or evil desire) may be moved with desire in his heart, but speak good words.

33.Abdul Hye: Stay in your homes and don’t display yourselves like that of the times of the first ignorance (pre-Islamic days); establish prayer, give obligatory charity, and obey Allah and His Messenger. O members of the family (of the prophet), Allah only wishes to remove evil deeds from you and to purify you perfectly.

34.Abdul Hye: And remember the Verses of Allah and the wisdom (Prophet’s sayings) which are recited in your houses, surely, Allah is Courteous, Well-Acquainted.

35.Abdul Hye: Surely, the Muslim men and the Muslim women, the believing men and the believing women, the obedient men and the obedient women, the truthful men and the truthful women, the patient men and the patient women, the humble men and the humble women, the charitable men and the charitable women, the fasting men and the fasting women, the men who guard their chastity and the women who guard it, the men who remember Allah much and the women who remember Allah - for all of them, Allah has prepared forgiveness and a great reward (Paradise).

36.Abdul Hye: It is not proper for a believing man or a believing woman to have any option for them in their decision when Allah and His Messenger have decreed a matter. Whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger, has indeed strayed into clear error.

37.Abdul Hye: And (remember) when you (Muhammad) said to him (Zaid, prophet’s adopted son) on whom Allah has bestowed Grace (by guiding to Islam) and you too have done favor (by freeing from captivity): “Keep your wife to yourself and fear Allah.” But you did hide in yourself what (Allah has already made known to you that He will give her (Zaid’s wife) to you in marriage) Allah will make it clear and you did fear the people (that Muhammad married the divorced wife of his captive) whereas Allah had a better right that you should fear Him. So when Zaid had performed the necessary formality (divorced her), We gave her to you in marriage, so that (in future) there may be no blame on the believers in respect of the wives of their adopted sons, when the latter have performed the necessary formality (divorced) from them. And the Command of Allah must be fulfilled.

38.Abdul Hye: There is no blame on the prophet in that which Allah has made legal for him. That is the Way of Allah with those who have passed away before. And the Command of Allah is a decree preordained.

39.Abdul Hye: Those who convey the message of Allah and fear Him, don’t fear anyone except Allah. Allah is sufficient as a Reckoner (to take account).

40.Abdul Hye: Muhammad is not the father of any of your men (he will not leave any son), but he is the Messenger of Allah and the Last of the prophets. Allah is All-Aware of everything.

41.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Remember Allah with much remembrance,

42.Abdul Hye: and glorify His Praises morning and afternoon.

43.Abdul Hye: It is Allah Who sends blessings on you (believers), and (also) His angels, so that He may bring you out from darkness into light. And He is Merciful to the believers.

44.Abdul Hye: Their greeting on the Day they shall meet Allah will be: “Peace!” And Allah has prepared for them a generous reward (Paradise).

45.Abdul Hye: O Prophet (Muhammad)! Surely, We have sent you as a witness and a bearer of good news and a Warner,

46.Abdul Hye: and a caller to Allah by His permission, and as a lamp spreading light (guidance).

47.Abdul Hye: And give glad tidings to the believers that there is a great Bounty for them from Allah.

48.Abdul Hye: And don’t obey the disbelievers and the hypocrites and disregard their harm. Put your trust in Allah and Allah is sufficient as a Trustee.

49.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! When you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have sexual intercourse with them, you don’t count on them Iddah (waiting period after divorce) in respect of them. So give them a present and set them free (divorce) in an honorable way.

50.Abdul Hye: O Prophet (Muhammad)! Surely, We have made lawful to you: your wives to whom you have paid their bridal money (given by husband to wife at the time of marriage); those (captives) whom your right hand possesses - whom Allah has given to you; the daughters of your paternal uncles and aunts, the daughters of your maternal uncles and aunts who have migrated (from Makkah) with you; a believing woman if she offers herself to the prophet and if the Prophet wishes to marry her - a privilege for you (only) other than the believers. Indeed We know what We have enjoined upon them (believers) about their wives and those (captives) whom their right hands possess, in order that there should be no difficulty on you. And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

51.Abdul Hye: You (O Muhammad) can postpone (the turn for your company) whom you will of them (your wives), and you may receive to you whom you will. There is no sin on you if you desire any of those whom you have set aside (temporarily). It is better that their eyes may be cooled and they don’t grieve, and may be pleased with what you give all of them. And Allah knows what is in your hearts. Allah is All-Knowing, Forbearing.

52.Abdul Hye: It is not lawful for you (O Muhammad) to marry more women after this, or to change them (present wives) for other wives even though their beauty attracts you, except those (captives) whom your right hand possesses. Allah is a Watcher over all things.

53.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Don’t enter the houses of the prophet, except when permission is given to you for a meal, and then don’t wait for its preparation. But when you are invited, then enter and when you have taken your meal, then disperse, without sitting for a talk. Surely, such behavior annoys the prophet, he is shy in asking you to leave, but Allah is not shy of telling you the truth. When you ask them (his wives) for anything, ask them from behind a curtain. This is purer for your hearts and for their hearts. It is not proper for you to annoy the Messenger of Allah, nor that you should ever marry his wives after him (his death). Surely! With Allah that would be a grievous offence.

54.Abdul Hye: Whether you reveal anything or conceal it, surely, Allah is All-Knower of everything.

55.Abdul Hye: There is no sin on them (Prophet’s wives, if they appear unveiled) before their fathers, their sons, their brothers, their brother’s sons, their sister’s sons, their own (believing) women, those whom their right hand possesses (their female captives), fear Allah. Surely, Allah is All-Witness over everything.

56.Abdul Hye: Indeed Allah and His angels send blessings on the prophet (Muhammad). O you who believe! Send your blessings on him (Muhammad) and greet him with greetings (Assalamu Alaikum).

57.Abdul Hye: Surely, those who annoy Allah and His Messenger, Allah has cursed them in this world and in the Hereafter and has prepared for them a humiliating punishment.

58.Abdul Hye: Those who annoy believing men and believing women without any fault of theirs, then indeed they shall bear the crime of slander and plain sin.

59.Abdul Hye: O Prophet! Tell your wives, your daughters, and the believing women to draw their veils over them. That is better so that they will be recognized and not annoyed. And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

60.Abdul Hye: If the hypocrites, those in whose hearts there is a disease (of evil desires), and those who spread false news among the people in Madinah, don’t desist, We shall let you overpower them, then they will not be able to stay in the city as your neighbors but for a little while.

61.Abdul Hye: They shall be cursed wherever they are found; they shall be seized, and killed with a (terrible) slaughter.

62.Abdul Hye: This has been the Way of Allah in the case of those who passed away before and you will never find a change in the Way of Allah.

63.Abdul Hye: People ask you about the Hour (of Judgment), say: “The knowledge of it is with Allah. What do you know? It may be that the Hour is near!”

64.Abdul Hye: Surely, Allah has cursed the disbelievers and has prepared for them a flaming fire (hell).

65.Abdul Hye: They will abide in it forever. Neither will they find a protector nor a helper

66.Abdul Hye: On the Day when their faces will be turned over in the fire, they will say: “Oh, would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger (Muhammad).

67.Abdul Hye: And they will also say: “Our Lord! Surely, we obeyed our chiefs and our great ones, and they misled us from the Right Way.

68.Abdul Hye: Our Lord! Give them double punishment and curse them with a mighty curse!”

69.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Be not like those who annoyed Moses, but Allah cleared him of that which they alleged, and he was honorable with Allah.

70.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Fear Him and speak the truth.

71.Abdul Hye: He will bless your deeds and forgive your sins. Those who obey Allah and His Messenger, they have indeed won a great victory.

72.Abdul Hye: Truly, We did offer the trust (of moral responsibility, honesty, and all duties which Allah has ordained) to the heavens, the earth, and the mountains, but they declined to undertake it and were afraid of (punishment) it. But human undertook it. Surely, human was unjust (to themselves) and ignorant (of results).

73.Abdul Hye: Allah will punish the hypocrites, men and women, and those men and women who associate partners with Allah. And Allah will pardon the believing men and the believing women. Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

1.Abdul Hye: All the praises be to Allah to whom belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth. To Whom be all the praises and thanks in the Hereafter. And He is the All-Wise, the All-Aware.

2.Abdul Hye: He knows that which goes into the earth and that which comes out from it, and that which comes down from the heaven and that which goes up to it. And He is the Merciful, the Forgiving.

3.Abdul Hye: Those who disbelieve say: “The Hour (of Judgment) will not come to us.” Say: “Yes, by my Lord, it will surely come to you. He knows all the unseen, not even the weight of an atom escapes from His knowledge in the heavens or in the earth; nor there is anything smaller or greater than that, but is recorded in the clear book.”

4.Abdul Hye: He will reward those who believe and do righteous deeds. They are those for whom there is forgiveness and a generous provision

5.Abdul Hye: But those who strive against Our Revelations to frustrate them, there will be a severe painful punishment for them.

6.Abdul Hye: And those who have been given the knowledge can see that the revelations sent to you (O Muhammad) from your Lord are the truth, and it guides to the Way of the Exalted in Might, Owner of all praise.

7.Abdul Hye: Those who disbelieve say: “Shall we direct you to a man (Muhammad) who will tell you that when you will become fully disintegrated (after death into dust) with full dispersion, then surely you will be created new (again)?”

8.Abdul Hye: Has he (Muhammad) invented a lie against Allah, or is there madness in him? Nay, but those who disbelieve in the Hereafter are in punishment, and in gross error.

9.Abdul Hye: Don’t they see what is before them and what is behind them in the heaven and the earth? If We will, We can sink the earth with them, or cause a piece of the heaven to fall upon them. Surely, there is a sign for every believer who turns to Allah in repentance.

10.Abdul Hye: Indeed We bestowed grace on David (saying): “O mountains! Glorify (Allah) with him!” The birds also! And We made the iron soft for him,

11.Abdul Hye: (saying) that: “You make perfect coats of mail armor and balance well (the rings) of chain armor, and you do righteous deeds. Truly, I am All-Seer of what you do.”

12.Abdul Hye: And to Solomon (We subjected) the wind, its morning (sunrise to mid noon) was a month’s (journey), and its afternoon (midday to sunset) was a month’s (journey). And We caused a spring of (molten) brass to flow for him, the jinn worked in front of him by the permission of his Lord, and if any of them turned aside from Our Command; We caused him to taste the punishment of the blazing fire.

13.Abdul Hye: They worked for him what he desired of making high rooms, images, basins as large as reservoirs, and cooking fixed (in their places) vat. (We said): “O family of David! You work with thanks!” But few of My devotees are grateful.

14.Abdul Hye: When We decreed death for him (Solomon was leaning on his stick), no one informed the jinns of his death until a little termite of the earth chew away his stick and he fell down. The jinns saw clearly that if they had known the unseen, they would not have stayed in the humiliating punishment (of their task).

15.Abdul Hye: Indeed for the people of Sheba (a town in Yemen) there was a sign in their residing place: 2 gardens - one on the right and one on the left. (It was said to them): “Eat of the provision of your Lord and be grateful to Him, a fair land and a Forgiving Lord.”

16.Abdul Hye: But they turned away (from Allah). So We sent against them a flood of Arim (released water from the dam), and We converted their 2 gardens into gardens producing bitter fruits, shrubs, and some few lote-trees.

17.Abdul Hye: This is how We punished them because they were ungrateful (disbelievers). And We never punish except those who are ungrateful.

18.Abdul Hye: And We placed between them and between the towns which We had blessed, towns easy to be seen, and We made easy stages of journey between them (saying): “Travel in them safely night and day.”

19.Abdul Hye: But they said: “Our Lord! Make the stages longer between our journeys.” They wronged themselves, so We made them (in the land) as tales, and We dispersed them in a total scattering. Surely, there are signs for every patient, grateful person.

20.Abdul Hye: And indeed Satan did prove its thought true about them and they all followed him except a group of believers.

21.Abdul Hye: And there was no authority for him (Satan) over them except that We might test him who believes in the Hereafter from him who is in doubt about it. Your Lord is watching over everything.

22.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad to those polytheists): “Call upon those (deities) whom you assert besides Allah, they don’t possess even the weight of an atom in the heavens or on the earth, nor they have any share in either, nor there is any supporter from among them for Him.”

23.Abdul Hye: No intercession with Him profits anyone except for the one whom He permits. Until when the fear will be removed from their hearts, they (angels) shall say: “What your Lord has said?” They say: “The Truth.” Allah is the High, the Great.

24.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad to these polytheists): “Who gives you provision from the heavens and the earth?” Say: “Allah, and surely, (either) we or you are on guidance or in a plain error.”

25.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad to these polytheists): “You will not be asked about our sins, nor we will be asked about your deeds.”

26.Abdul Hye: Say: “Our Lord will assemble us all together (on the Day of Resurrection), then He will judge between us with truth. And He is the Trust-worthy judge, All-Knower of everything.”

27.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad to these polytheists): “Show me those whom you have joined with Him as partners. Nay! But He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.”

28.Abdul Hye: And We have sent you (O Muhammad) as a giver of glad tidings and a Warner for all mankind, but most of people don’t know.

29.Abdul Hye: And they say: “When is this Promise (the Day of Resurrection will be fulfilled) if you are truthful?”

30.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “The appointment Day is fixed, which you can neither put back from it for an Hour nor put forward.”

31.Abdul Hye: And those who disbelieve say: “We don’t believe in this Qur’an nor in that which came before it.” If you could see when the wrongdoers will be made to stand before their Lord, how they will refer the blaming word some of them to others! Those who were deemed weak will say to those who were arrogant: “Had it not been for you, we would certainly have been believers!”

32.Abdul Hye: And those who were arrogant will say to those who were deemed weak: “Did we keep you back from guidance after when it had come to you? Nay, but you yourself were sinners.”

33.Abdul Hye: Those who were deemed weak will say to those who were arrogant: “Nay, but it was you who plotted night and day, when you ordered us to disbelieve in Allah and set up rivals to Him!” They will conceal their own regret (for disobeying Allah in this world) when they will see the punishment. And We shall put iron collars round the necks of those who disbelieved. Are they rewarded exactly for what they did?

34.Abdul Hye: And whenever We have sent a Warner to a town, its wealthy people said: “Surely we don’t believe in (the message) what you are sent with.”

35.Abdul Hye: And they say: “We have more wealth and children (our deities are happy), and we shall not be punished.”

36.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “Surely, my Lord enlarges and restricts the provision to whom He wills, but most people don’t know.”

37.Abdul Hye: It is neither your wealth, nor your children that bring you nearer to Us. But those who believe, and do righteous deeds; for such, they will have double reward for what they did, and they will reside in the high residences (Paradise) in peace and security.

38.Abdul Hye: And those who strive against Our Verses to frustrate them, the punishment will be brought to them.

39.Abdul Hye: Say: “Truly, my Lord enlarges the provision for whom He wills of His servants, and also restricts it for some. Whatever you spend of anything (for Allah), He will replace it. And He is the best of providers.”

40.Abdul Hye: And (remember) the Day when He will gather them all together and then will say to the angels: “Was it you that these people used to worship?”

41.Abdul Hye: They (angels) will say: “Glory be to You! You are our Lord instead of them. Nay, but they used to worship the jinns; most of them were believers in them.”

42.Abdul Hye: So today (the Day of Resurrection) none of you has power to profit or harm one another. And We shall say to those who did wrong: “Taste the punishment of the fire which you denied.”

43.Abdul Hye: And when Our clear Verses are recited to them, they say: “This man (Muhammad) wishes to hinder you from that which your forefathers used to worship.” Others say: “This is nothing but an invented lie.” Those who disbelieve in the truth when it has come to them say: “This is nothing but plain magic!”

44.Abdul Hye: And We had neither given them Scriptures to study, nor sent to them any Warner (Messenger) before you (O Muhammad).

45.Abdul Hye: And those who were before them denied; they have not received 1/10th of what We had granted to them, yet they denied My Messengers, then see how was My punishment!

46.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad to them): “I urge you on one thing only that you stand up for Allah’s sake in pairs and individually, and then ponder (yourself the history of Muhammad), is there any madness in your companion (Muhammad)? He is only a Warner to you before a severe punishment.”

47.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “Whatever reward I might have asked of you is for you. My reward is only from Allah and He is witness over every thing.”

48.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “Surely! My Lord sends down the truth, the All-Knower of the unseen.”

49.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “The truth (the Qur’an) has come, and neither falsehood can create anything nor resurrect (anything).”

50.Abdul Hye: Say: “(Even) if I go astray, surely, I shall stray only to myself. But if I remain guided, it is for what my Lord has revealed to me. Truly, Allah is All-Hearer, Ever Near (to all).”

51.Abdul Hye: And if you could only see when they (disbelievers on the Day of Judgment) will be terrified with no escape, and they will be seized from a nearby place.

52.Abdul Hye: And they will say (in the Hereafter): “We do believe now in it;” but how could they receive faith from a place so far off?

53.Abdul Hye: Indeed they did disbelieve in it before (in the world), and they used to guess about the unseen (the Hereafter) from a far place.

54.Abdul Hye: And a barrier will be placed between them and what they desired (turning to Allah in repentance), as was done before with the people of their kind. Surely, they were in grave doubt.

1.Abdul Hye: All the praise be to Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth, Who has made the angels with 2, 3 or 4 (pairs of) wings as Messengers. He adds to creation as He wills. Surely, Allah has power over every thing.

2.Abdul Hye: Whatever Mercy Allah grants to mankind, none can withhold it; and whatever He withholds, none can grant it thereafter. Allah is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

3.Abdul Hye: O mankind! Remember the Grace of Allah upon you! Is there any creator other than Allah who provides for you from the heaven and the earth? There is no one worthy of worship but He. How then are you being deceived?

4.Abdul Hye: And if they deny you (O Muhammad), so surely Messengers were denied before you. And to Allah all matters return (for decision).

5.Abdul Hye: O mankind! Surely, the Promise of Allah is true. So don’t let the worldly life deceive you, and don’t let the chief deceiver (Satan) deceive you about Allah.

6.Abdul Hye: Surely, Satan is an enemy to you, so take him as an enemy. He only invites his followers so that they may become the inmates of the blazing fire.

7.Abdul Hye: Those who disbelieve, there will be a severe punishment for them; and those who believe and do righteous deeds, there will be forgiveness and a great reward for them.

8.Abdul Hye: Can those (be guided), to whom their evil deeds made fair seeming, so that they consider them good? Surely, Allah sends astray whom He wills, and guides whom He wills. So don’t destroy yourself (O Muhammad) for them in sorrow. Truly, Allah is the All-Knower of what they do!

9.Abdul Hye: And it is Allah Who sends the winds to rise up the clouds, then We drive them to a dead land, and therewith revives the earth after its death. Such will be the Resurrection (of the dead)!

10.Abdul Hye: Whoever desires the honor, (should know that) all honor belongs to Allah alone. Good Words ascend to Allah and the righteous deeds are exalted by Allah. But those who plot evils, they will have severe punishment and their plots will perish.

11.Abdul Hye: And Allah has created you from dust, then from a drop of semen, and then He made you pairs. No female conceives or gives birth without His Knowledge. No aged human is granted a long life or the life is cut short but is written in a book. Surely, that is easy for Allah.

12.Abdul Hye: And the 2 seas are not alike - one is fresh sweet and pleasant to drink; and the other is salty and bitter. Yet, from each of them you eat fresh meat (fish) and get ornaments to wear. You see the ships sailing through them, that you may seek His Bounty, and that you may give thanks.

13.Abdul Hye: He merges the night into the day and the day into the night. And He has subjected the sun and the moon (to serve you), each runs (its course) for an appointed term. Such is Allah, your Lord; His is the kingdom. Those to whom you pray instead of Him, don’t even own a thin membrane of a date-stone.

14.Abdul Hye: If you pray to them, they don’t hear your call, and even if they hear you, they can not answer you. On the Day of Resurrection, they will disown your worshipping them. None can inform you (O mankind) like the One Who is the All-Knower.

15.Abdul Hye: O mankind! It is you who stands in need of Allah, but Allah is Rich, Praise-Worthy.

16.Abdul Hye: If He wills, He can destroy you and replace with a new creation,

17.Abdul Hye: and that is not difficult for Allah.

18.Abdul Hye: And no bearer of burdens shall bear another’s burden, and if one heavily laden calls another to carry it (load), nothing will be lifted from it even though he is a close relative. You (O Muhammad) can only warn those who fear their unseen Lord, and establish prayers. Those who purify themselves, and then they purify only for their own selves. To Allah is the final return.

19.Abdul Hye: The blind (disbelievers) and the seeing (believers) are not alike;

20.Abdul Hye: nor the darkness (disbelief) and the light (belief)

21.Abdul Hye: nor the shade and the sun’s heat;

22.Abdul Hye: nor the living and the dead. Surely, Allah can make hear whom He wills, but you (O Muhammad) cannot make those hear who are in graves.

23.Abdul Hye: You (O Muhammad) are not but a Warner.

24.Abdul Hye: Surely! We have sent you (O Muhammad) with the truth as a bearer of good news, and as a Warner. And there was not a nation which did not have a Warner.

25.Abdul Hye: And if they deny you, so surely were those who came before. Their Messengers came to them with clear signs, with the Scriptures, and the light-giving book.

26.Abdul Hye: Then I seized those who disbelieved, and how terrible was My denial (punishment)!

27.Abdul Hye: Don’t you see that Allah sends down rain from the sky and We produce therewith fruits of varying colors? Among the mountains there are streaks (paths) white and red of varying colors and very black.

28.Abdul Hye: And likewise, men, beasts, and cattle have various colors. It is only those among His servants who have knowledge that fear Allah. Surely, Allah is All-Mighty, Forgiving.

29.Abdul Hye: Surely, those who recite the book of Allah (this Qur’an), establish prayer, and spend (in charity) out of what We have provided for them, secretly and openly, may hope for business (gain) that will never perish.

30.Abdul Hye: That He may pay them their rewards in full and give them more out of His Grace. Surely! He is forgiving, ready to appreciate (good deeds).

31.Abdul Hye: And that which We have revealed in you (O Muhammad) of the book (the Qur’an), it is the truth which confirms what was revealed before. Surely! Allah is indeed All-Aware, and All-Seer of His servants.

32.Abdul Hye: Then We gave the book (the Qur’an) as an inheritance to those of Our servants (Muslims) whom We have chosen. Among them there are some who wrong their own selves, some of them follow a middle course, and some of them are foremost in good deeds by the permission of Allah. That is the great grace.

33.Abdul Hye: They will enter the gardens of Eden where they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls and their garments will be silk therein.

34.Abdul Hye: They will say: “All the praise be to Allah Who has removed all grief from us. Surely, our Lord is indeed Forgiving, Ready to appreciate (good deeds),

35.Abdul Hye: Who has admitted us in a home (in Paradise) that will last forever out of His Grace; where no toil will touch us nor any weariness.”

36.Abdul Hye: But those who disbelieve, there will be fire of hell for them. Neither it (fire) will be completed on them so that they die, nor shall its punishment be lightened for them. Thus We do pay back every disbeliever!

37.Abdul Hye: They will cry therein: “Our Lord! Get us out, (from now) we shall do righteous deeds and shall not repeat that (evil deeds) which we used to do.” (Allah will reply): “Did We not give you lives long enough so that whoever would, could receive warning therein? And the Warner came to you. So taste (the evil of your deeds), there is no helper for the wrongdoers.”

38.Abdul Hye: Surely, Allah is the All-Knower of the unseen of the heavens and the earth. Surely! He is the All-Knower of what is in the hearts.

39.Abdul Hye: It is He Who has made you vicegerent in the earth. Whoever disbelieves, bears the burden of disbelief. And their disbelief of the disbelievers does not add anything except the Wrath of their Lord. And the disbelief of the disbelievers adds nothing but loss.

40.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “What do you think about your partner to whom you call upon besides Allah? Show me, what they have created in the earth? Or do they have any share in the heavens? Or have We given them a book so that they act on clear proof from there? Nay, the wrongdoers promise one another nothing but delusions.”

41.Abdul Hye: Surely! Allah grasps the heavens and the earth lest they move away (from their places). Even if they were to move away (from their places), there is none who could grasp them besides Him. Truly, He is ever Forbearing, Forgiving.

42.Abdul Hye: And they swore by Allah their most binding oath that if a Warner ever come to them, they would be more guided than any of the nations (before them). Yet, when a Warner (Muhammad) has come to them, it increased nothing in them but flight (from the truth),

43.Abdul Hye: (because of their) arrogance in the land and their plotting of evil. The evil plotting encompasses only those who make it. Can they expect anything but the way of former peoples? So you will not find any change in the Way of Allah and will not find any alternation in the Way of Allah.

44.Abdul Hye: Have they not traveled in the land and seen how terrible was the end of those who were before them, who were greater in power than them? There is nothing in the heavens or in the earth which can escape Him. Surely, Allah is the All-Knower, All-Powerful.

45.Abdul Hye: And if Allah were to punish people for their evil deeds, He would not leave any creature on the surface (of the earth), but He is giving them respite for an appointed term, and when their term will come, they surely will realize that Allah is All-Seer of His servants.

1.Abdul Hye: Ya-Seen.

2.Abdul Hye: By the Qur’an, full of wisdom,

3.Abdul Hye: truly, you (O Muhammad) are one of the Messengers,

4.Abdul Hye: on a Right Way.

5.Abdul Hye: This is sent down by the Mighty, the Merciful,

6.Abdul Hye: to warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are heedless.

7.Abdul Hye: Indeed the Word has proved true against most of them, so they don’t believe.

8.Abdul Hye: Surely! We have put on their necks iron collars up to the chins so that their heads are made raised up

9.Abdul Hye: and We have put a barrier in front of them, and a barrier behind them, and then We have covered them up so they cannot see.

10.Abdul Hye: It is the same to them whether you warn them or you warn them not, they will not believe.

11.Abdul Hye: You can only warn those who follow the reminder (the Qur’an) and fear the Gracious (Allah) unseen. So give them good news of forgiveness and a generous reward.

12.Abdul Hye: Surely, We will give life to the dead; We are recording all that which they are sending before death and their traces of deeds. We have recorded everything in a clear book.

13.Abdul Hye: And put forward to them an example; the story of the residents of the town (Antakiya, Turkey) to whom the Messengers came.

14.Abdul Hye: When We sent to them 2 Messengers, they denied them both, so We reinforced them with a 3rd, and they said: “Surely! We have been sent to you as Messengers.”

15.Abdul Hye: They (people of the town) said: “You are but humans like us. The Gracious (Allah) has revealed nothing, you are telling lies.”

16.Abdul Hye: They (Messengers) said: “Our Lord knows that we have been sent as Messengers to you

17.Abdul Hye: and our duty is to convey the message clearly.”

18.Abdul Hye: They (people) said: “Surely, we see an evil omen (sign) from you. If you don’t stop, we will surely stone you and a painful punishment will touch you from us.”

19.Abdul Hye: They (Messengers) said: “Your evil omens be with you! (Do you call it ‘evil omen’) because you are admonished? Nay, but you are a transgressing people.”

20.Abdul Hye: And there came a man running from the farthest part of the town and said: “O my people! Follow the Messengers.

21.Abdul Hye: Follow those who don’t ask of you any wages and they are rightly guided.

22.Abdul Hye: Why should I not worship Him Who has created me and to Whom you shall be returned?

23.Abdul Hye: Shall I take another worthy of worship besides Him? If the Gracious (Allah) intends me no harm, their intercession will avail me nothing, nor can they save me.

24.Abdul Hye: Then surely, I would be in plain error.

25.Abdul Hye: Surely! I have believed in your Lord, so listen to me!”

26.Abdul Hye: It was said (to him when the disbelievers killed him): “Enter Paradise.” He said: “Would that my people knew (what I know)!

27.Abdul Hye: That my Lord has forgiven me and made me among the honored ones!”

28.Abdul Hye: And We did not send down against his people after him a host from heaven, nor do We send (such a thing).

29.Abdul Hye: It was only one shout and then they all were dead silent

30.Abdul Hye: Alas for the mankind! Whenever a Messenger came to them, they used to mock at him.

31.Abdul Hye: Don’t they see how many generations We have destroyed before them who will not return to them?

32.Abdul Hye: And surely, all of them will be brought before Us.

33.Abdul Hye: And the dead land is a sign for them. We give it life and brings forth grain from it so that they eat from there.

34.Abdul Hye: And We produces in it gardens of date-palms and grapes, and We cause springs of water to gush forth from it,

35.Abdul Hye: so that they may eat the fruits thereof. Their hands did not make it. Should they not give thanks?

36.Abdul Hye: Glory be to Him Who has created all things in pairs which the earth produces, as well as their own (human) kind, and other things which they don’t know.

37.Abdul Hye: And a sign for them is the night, when We withdraw the daylight from it, and behold, they are in darkness.

38.Abdul Hye: And the sun runs on its fixed course for a term (appointed) for it. That is the Decree of the All-Mighty, the All-Knower.

39.Abdul Hye: And the moon, We have measured its positions (phases) for it till it returns like the old dried curved date stalk.

40.Abdul Hye: The sun is neither permitted to overtake the moon nor does the night outstrip the day. They all each float in its own orbit.

41.Abdul Hye: And a sign for them is that We carried their offspring in the laden ship (of Noah).

42.Abdul Hye: And We have created for them similar (vessels) on which they ride.

43.Abdul Hye: And if We will, We can drown them, and there will be no helper for them, nor will they be saved,

44.Abdul Hye: except through the Mercy from Us and as an enjoyment for a while.

45.Abdul Hye: And when it is said to them: “Beware of that which is before you (worldly punishments) and that which is behind you (punishments in the Hereafter) so that you may receive Mercy.”

46.Abdul Hye: And whenever a sign of the Verses of their Lord comes to them, they turn away from it.

47.Abdul Hye: Whenever it is said to them:“Spend out of what Allah has provided you.” Those who disbelieve say to those who believe: “Should we feed those whom, if Allah wills, He (Himself) can feed? You are in plain error.

48.Abdul Hye: And they say: “When will this Promise (Resurrection) be fulfilled if you are truthful?”

49.Abdul Hye: They are waiting for a single shout, which will seize them while they are disputing (among themselves)!

50.Abdul Hye: Then, they will neither be able to make a will, nor they will be able to return to their family.

51.Abdul Hye: And the trumpet will be blown in and behold! They will come out quickly from the graves to their Lord.

52.Abdul Hye: They will say: “Woe to us! Who has raised us up from our place of sleep?” (It will be said to them): “This is what the Gracious (Allah) had promised and the Messengers spoke the truth!”

53.Abdul Hye: It will only be a single shout, so behold! They all will be brought up before Us!

54.Abdul Hye: This Day (of Resurrection), no soul will be wronged in anything and you will be rewarded for your deeds.

55.Abdul Hye: Surely, on that Day, the residents of the Paradise will be busy in joyful things;

56.Abdul Hye: they and their wives will be in pleasant shade reclining on thrones.

57.Abdul Hye: They will have all kinds of fruits in it and they will get whatever they ask for;

58.Abdul Hye: (it will be said to them): “Peace,” a Word from the Lord, Merciful.

59.Abdul Hye: (It will be said to sinners): “You get apart this Day, you criminals (from the believers).

60.Abdul Hye: O Children of Adam! Did I not command you that you should not worship Satan? Surely, he is a plain enemy to you

61.Abdul Hye: and you should worship Me. That is the Right Way.

62.Abdul Hye: And indeed he (Satan) has led a great number of you astray. Didn’t you understand?

63.Abdul Hye: This is hell which you were warned.

64.Abdul Hye: Now burn in it this Day for what you used to disbelieve.”

65.Abdul Hye: This Day, We shall seal up their mouths, their hands will speak to Us, and their legs will bear witness to what they used to earn.

66.Abdul Hye: And (if it had been) Our will, We could surely have wiped out (blinded) over their eyes so that they would struggle for the way, how then could they see?

67.Abdul Hye: And if it had been Our will, We could have transformed them (into animals or lifeless objects) in their places. Then neither they could have been able to go forward nor they could have turned back.

68.Abdul Hye: And those to whom We grant long life, We reverse them in creation (weakness after strength). Will they not then understand?

69.Abdul Hye: And We have not taught him (Muhammad) poetry, nor is it suitable for him. This is only a reminder and a plain Qur’an,

70.Abdul Hye: to warn those who are living and to establish the charge against the disbelievers.

71.Abdul Hye: Don’t they see that We have created for them of what Our Hands have fashioned the cattle, which are under their dominion?

72.Abdul Hye: And We have subdued them (animals) to them so that they have some of them for riding and some of them they eat,

73.Abdul Hye: and there are other benefits in them and drinks (milk) for them. Should they not then be grateful?

74.Abdul Hye: Yet, they have taken others (worthy of worship) besides Allah hoping to get their help.

75.Abdul Hye: They cannot help them, yet, they will be brought forward as troops against those who worshipped them (at the time of Reckoning).

76.Abdul Hye: So let not their speech grieves you (O Muhammad). Surely, We know what they conceal and what they reveal.

77.Abdul Hye: Don’t people see that We have created them from a sperm? Yet, they (stands up) as open opponent.

78.Abdul Hye: And they put an example for Us and forget their own creations. He says: “Who will give life to these bones when they have rotten away and became dust?”

79.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “He Who has created them for the first time, will give life to them again! And He is the All-Knower of every creation!”

80.Abdul Hye: It is He Who produces for you fire from the green tree, then behold, you kindle fire therewith.

81.Abdul Hye: Is not He Who has created the heavens and the earth, able to create the like of them? Yes, indeed! He knows everything, supreme Creator.

82.Abdul Hye: Surely, when He intends a thing, it is only that He says: “Be!” and it is!

83.Abdul Hye: So glory be to Him in Whose hands (authority) is the dominion of every thing, and to Him you shall be returned.

37.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Set The Ranks, Drawn up in Ranks, The Rangers

1.Abdul Hye: By those (angels) arranged in rows,

2.Abdul Hye: by those (angels) who are strong in repelling (evil),

3.Abdul Hye: by those (angels) who bring the book (the Qur’an),

4.Abdul Hye: surely your one worthy of worship is indeed One (Allah),

5.Abdul Hye: the Lord of the heavens and the earth, and all that lies between them, and Lord of every point of the sun’s risings.

6.Abdul Hye: Surely! We have adorned the lower heaven with beautiful stars

7.Abdul Hye: and has guarded against all rebellious devils.

8.Abdul Hye: They cannot even listen to the higher group (angels) for they are pelted from every side,

9.Abdul Hye: repulsed and they are under a constant punishment.

10.Abdul Hye: Except such as snatch away something by stealing and they are pursued by a flaming fire of piercing brightness.

11.Abdul Hye: Ask them (polytheists, O Muhammad): “Are they stronger as creation, or those whom We have created?” Surely, We created them of sticky clay.

12.Abdul Hye: Nay, you (Muhammad) wonder while they mock (at you and the Qur’an).

13.Abdul Hye: When they are reminded, they don’t pay attention,

14.Abdul Hye: and when they see a Verse (from Allah), they mock at it

15.Abdul Hye: and say: “This is nothing but clear magic!

16.Abdul Hye: When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then surely be resurrected?

17.Abdul Hye: Also our forefathers of old times?”

18.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “Yes and you shall then be humiliated.”

19.Abdul Hye: It will be only a single shout and they will be staring!

20.Abdul Hye: They will say: “Woe to us! This is the Day of recompense!”

21.Abdul Hye: (It will be said): “This is the Day of judgment which you used to deny.”

22.Abdul Hye: (It will be said to the angels): “Assemble those who did wrong, together with their companions whom they used to worship

23.Abdul Hye: besides Allah, and lead them to the way of flaming fire (hell).”

24.Abdul Hye: (When they will be gathered, Allah will say): “Stop them, surely they are to be questioned:

25.Abdul Hye: What is the matter with you? Why don’t you help one another (as you used to do in the world)?”

26.Abdul Hye: Nay, but that Day they shall surrender.

27.Abdul Hye: Some of them will face others to question one another.

28.Abdul Hye: They will say (to their leaders): “Surely, you used to come to us from the right (with authority to beautify every evil, enjoin polytheism, and stop us from the truth).”

29.Abdul Hye: They will reply: “Nay, you were not believers.

30.Abdul Hye: We had no authority over you. Nay! You were transgressing people,

31.Abdul Hye: now the Word of our Lord has become justified against us, and indeed we shall taste (the punishment).

32.Abdul Hye: So we led you astray because we were ourselves astray.”

33.Abdul Hye: Then surely on that Day, they will share in the punishment.

34.Abdul Hye: Certainly, that is how We shall deal with sinners

35.Abdul Hye: surely, when it was said to them: “There is no one worthy of worship but Allah,” they used to puff themselves up with pride

36.Abdul Hye: and say: “Are we going to abandon our one worthy of worship for the sake of a mad poet?”

37.Abdul Hye: Nay! He (Muhammad) has come with the truth and he has confirmed the (previous) Messengers.

38.Abdul Hye: (It will be said): “Surely, you (polytheists) are going to taste the painful punishment;

39.Abdul Hye: and you will be requited nothing except for what you had done (evil deeds).”

40.Abdul Hye: Except the chosen (faithful) devotees of Allah,

41.Abdul Hye: those for them will have known provision:

42.Abdul Hye: fruits, and they shall be honored

43.Abdul Hye: in the gardens of delight (Paradise),

44.Abdul Hye: on the thrones facing one another,

45.Abdul Hye: served around (them) with a cup of pure wine,

46.Abdul Hye: crystal-white, delicious to the drinkers.

47.Abdul Hye: Neither they will have any kind of hurt, headache or sin in that, nor will they suffer intoxication from that.

48.Abdul Hye: With them will be chaste females restraining their glances (for husbands only) with wide and beautiful eyes

49.Abdul Hye: as if they were preserved eggs.

50.Abdul Hye: Some of them will turn to others, questioning each others.

51.Abdul Hye: One of them will say: “Surely, I had a companion for me (in the world),

52.Abdul Hye: who used to say: ‘Are you among those who believe (in Resurrection after death)?

53.Abdul Hye: When we die and become dust and bones, shall we indeed (be raised up) to receive reward or punishment (according to deeds)?”’

54.Abdul Hye: It will be said (to him): “Will you look down (to see the friend)?”

55.Abdul Hye: So the person looked down and saw friend in the midst of the fire.

56.Abdul Hye: The person said: “By Allah! You have nearly ruined me.

57.Abdul Hye: Had it not been for the Grace of my Lord, I would certainly have been among those brought forth (to hell).

58.Abdul Hye: (The believer in the heaven will say): “Are we then not to die (any more)

59.Abdul Hye: after our first death and we shall not be punished?”

60.Abdul Hye: Truly, this is the supreme success!

61.Abdul Hye: For such an end, let everyone strive who wishes to strive.

62.Abdul Hye: Is this (Paradise) a better entertainment or the tree of the Zaqqum (a horrible tree in hell)?

63.Abdul Hye: Truly, We have made it a trail for the wrongdoers.

64.Abdul Hye: Surely, it is a tree that grows in the bottom of hellfire,

65.Abdul Hye: the shoots of its fruit-stalks are like the heads of devils,

66.Abdul Hye: so truly, they will eat from it and fill their bellies from it.

67.Abdul Hye: Then surely, on top of that, they will be given a mixture of boiling water (to drink).

68.Abdul Hye: Then surely, their return is to the flaming fire of hell.

69.Abdul Hye: In fact, they found their fathers on the wrong way,

70.Abdul Hye: so they are too haste to follow their footsteps!

71.Abdul Hye: and indeed most of the ancient people went astray before them

72.Abdul Hye: and indeed We had sent warners (Messengers) among them.

73.Abdul Hye: Then see how was the end of those who were warned (all perished),

74.Abdul Hye: except the chosen (faithful) devotees of Allah.

75.Abdul Hye: And indeed Noah prayed to Us, and indeed We are the Best to answer (the prayer).

76.Abdul Hye: And We rescued him and his family from the great distress (drowning),

77.Abdul Hye: and made his progeny to be the only survivors,

78.Abdul Hye: and left for him (a good name) among generations to come in later times.

79.Abdul Hye: Peace be upon Noah (from Us) among the (people of) worlds!

80.Abdul Hye: Surely, thus We reward the righteous people.

81.Abdul Hye: Surely, he (Noah) was one of Our believing devotees.

82.Abdul Hye: Then We drowned the others (disbelievers).

83.Abdul Hye: Surely, among those who followed his (Noah’s) way was Abraham,

84.Abdul Hye: when he came to his Lord with a pure heart.

85.Abdul Hye: When he said to his father and to his people: “What is it you worship?

86.Abdul Hye: Is it a falsehood worthy of worship other than Allah that you seek?

87.Abdul Hye: Then what do you think about the Lord of the worlds?

88.Abdul Hye: Then he looked a glance at the stars,

89.Abdul Hye: and said: “Surely, I am sick (he did this trick to stay in their temple of idols to destroy them and not to accompany them to the pagan’s feast).”

90.Abdul Hye: So they turned away from him, and departed.

91.Abdul Hye: Then he turned to their idols and said: “Why don’t you eat (from food offered)?

92.Abdul Hye: What is the matter with you that you don’t speak?”

93.Abdul Hye: Then he turned upon them, striking with his right hand.

94.Abdul Hye: They (idol worshippers) came running towards him.

95.Abdul Hye: He said: ”Do you worship what you carve,

96.Abdul Hye: while Allah has created you and what you have make?”

97.Abdul Hye: They said: “Build for him a building (like a furnace) and throw him into the blazing fire!”

98.Abdul Hye: So they plotted against him, but We made them the lowest (humiliated).

99.Abdul Hye: He said (after his rescue from fire): “Surely, I am going to my Lord. He will guide me

100.Abdul Hye: My Lord! Grant me (offspring) from the righteous.”

101.Abdul Hye: So We gave him the glad tidings of a gentle boy.

102.Abdul Hye: When he (son) was old enough to walk with him, he said: “O my son! Surely, I have seen in the sleep (dream) that I am slaughtering you (sacrifice to Allah), so what do you think!” He said: “O my father! Do what you are commanded (by Allah), you shall find me of the patient.

103.Abdul Hye: Then, when they had both submitted themselves (to Allah), and he laid his son prostrate on his forehead (for sacrifice);

104.Abdul Hye: and Allah called out to him: “O Abraham!

105.Abdul Hye: Surely, you have fulfilled the dream!” Surely! Thus We reward the righteous people.

106.Abdul Hye: Surely, that was indeed a clear trial.

107.Abdul Hye: We ransomed his son for a great sacrifice

108.Abdul Hye: and We left for him (good name) among the later generations (to come).

110.Abdul Hye: Thus indeed We reward the righteous people.

111.Abdul Hye: Surely, he was one of Our believing devotees.

112.Abdul Hye: And We gave him the glad tidings of (his son) Isaac, a prophet from the righteous.

113.Abdul Hye: We blessed him and Isaac. Of their progeny, there are some who do right, and some plainly wrong themselves.

114.Abdul Hye: Indeed We gave Our Grace to Moses and Aaron.

115.Abdul Hye: We saved them and their people from the great distress;

116.Abdul Hye: and helped them, so they became victorious

117.Abdul Hye: We gave them the clear Scripture (Torah),

118.Abdul Hye: and guided them to the Right Way.

119.Abdul Hye: We left for them (a good name) among later generations (to come).

120.Abdul Hye: Peace be upon Moses and Aaron!

121.Abdul Hye: Surely, thus We do reward the righteous people.

122.Abdul Hye: Surely! They were of Our believing devotees.

123.Abdul Hye: Surely, Elias was one of the Messengers.

124.Abdul Hye: When he said to his people: “Will you not fear (Allah)?

125.Abdul Hye: Will you call upon Bal (idol) and forsake the best of creators,

126.Abdul Hye: Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your forefathers?”

127.Abdul Hye: But they denied him (Elias), so they will certainly be brought forth (to the punishment)

128.Abdul Hye: except the chosen (faithful) devotees of Allah.

129.Abdul Hye: We left for him (a good name) among later generations (to come).

131.Abdul Hye: Surely, thus We reward the righteous people.

132.Abdul Hye: Surely, he was one of Our believing devotees.

133.Abdul Hye: Surely, Lot was one of the Messengers.

134.Abdul Hye: When We saved him and all his family,

135.Abdul Hye: except an old woman (who was) among those who remained behind

136.Abdul Hye: then We destroyed the rest (the towns of Sodom at the Dead Sea in Jordan).

137.Abdul Hye: Surely, you pass by them in the morning,

138.Abdul Hye: and at night; will you not then reflect (think)?

139.Abdul Hye: Surely, Jonah was one of the Messengers.

140.Abdul Hye: When he ran to the laden ship,

141.Abdul Hye: he (agreed to) cast lots, and he was among the losers.

142.Abdul Hye: Then a (big) fish swallowed him while he had done an act worthy of blame.

143.Abdul Hye: Had it not been that he was of those who glorify (Allah),

144.Abdul Hye: he would have indeed remained in its belly (the fish) till the Day of Resurrection.

145.Abdul Hye: Then We cast him out on the naked shore while he was sick

146.Abdul Hye: and We caused a plant of gourd (squash) to grow over him.

147.Abdul Hye: Then We had sent him to a nation of 100,000 people or even more.

148.Abdul Hye: They believed; so We gave them enjoyment for a while.

149.Abdul Hye: Now ask them (disbelievers, O Muhammad): (Does it make sense that) your Lord should have only daughters while they choose to have sons

150.Abdul Hye: Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses

151.Abdul Hye: Surely, they invent a lie when they say:

152.Abdul Hye: “Allah has begotten (children). Surely, they are liars!”

153.Abdul Hye: Has He chosen daughters (rather than) sons?

154.Abdul Hye: What is the matter with you? How do you decide?

156.Abdul Hye: Or is there any plain authority for you?

157.Abdul Hye: Then bring your book if you are truthful!

158.Abdul Hye: They have invented a kinship between Him and the jinns, but indeed the jinns know quite well that they will be brought for account (before Allah)

159.Abdul Hye: Glory be to Allah! (He is free) from what they attribute to Him

160.Abdul Hye: except the chosen (faithful) devotees of Allah.

161.Abdul Hye: So, neither you nor those whom you worship (idols)

163.Abdul Hye: except those who are destined to burn in hell!

164.Abdul Hye: (The angels say): “There is one known place for us.

165.Abdul Hye: Surely, we stand in rows (for prayers);

166.Abdul Hye: surely, we are those who glorify (Allah).”

168.Abdul Hye: “If we had a reminder like the people of old received (before the coming of Muhammad)

169.Abdul Hye: we would have indeed been the chosen devotees of Allah!”

170.Abdul Hye: But (since the Qur’an has come) they disbelieve in it (the Qur’an), and they will come to know (the consequence soon)!

171.Abdul Hye: Surely, Our Word has gone forth for Our devotees, the Messengers,

172.Abdul Hye: that surely they would be victorious

173.Abdul Hye: and verily, Our hosts (soldiers) will be victorious.

174.Abdul Hye: So turn away (O Muhammad) from them for a while,

175.Abdul Hye: and watch them, and they shall see (your victory)!

176.Abdul Hye: Do they seek to hasten on Our Punishment?

177.Abdul Hye: Then, when it descends into their court-yard (near them), then evil will be the morning for those who had been warned!

178.Abdul Hye: So turn (O Muhammad) away from them for a while,

179.Abdul Hye: and watch (their downfall) and they shall see (your victory)!

180.Abdul Hye: Glory be to your Lord, the Lord of honor and power, (He is free) from what they attribute to Him!

182.Abdul Hye: and all the praise be to Allah, Lord of the worlds.

1.Abdul Hye: Sad. By the Qur’an full of reminding.

2.Abdul Hye: Surely, those who disbelieve are in false pride and opposition.

3.Abdul Hye: How many generations have We destroyed before them? They cried out when there was no longer time for escape!

4.Abdul Hye: They wonder that a Warner (Muhammad) has come to them from among themselves! The disbelievers say: “This (Muhammad) is a sorcerer, a liar.

5.Abdul Hye: Has he made all ones worthy of worship into one worthy of worship (Allah)? Surely, this is a strange thing!”

6.Abdul Hye: The leaders among them went about (saying): “Go on, and remain firm to your one worthy of worship! Surely, this is a thing designed (against you)!

7.Abdul Hye: We have not heard like this in the religion of the Last days. This is nothing but an invention!

8.Abdul Hye: Has the reminder been sent down to him alone from among us?” Nay! but they are in doubt about My Reminder (this Qur’an)! Nay, but they have not tasted (My) punishment!

9.Abdul Hye: Or do they have the treasures of the Mercy of your Lord, the All-Mighty, the Real Bestower?

10.Abdul Hye: Or is the dominion of the heavens and the earth for them and what is between them? If so, let them ascend up with their means!

11.Abdul Hye: They will be like a defeated army of the confederates (who were defeated).

12.Abdul Hye: Before them the people of Noah, Ad, Pharaoh, and the people of stakes, denied (Messengers)

13.Abdul Hye: and Thamud, and the people of Lot, and the residents of the wood (Median); such were the confederates,

14.Abdul Hye: each of them denied the Messengers, therefore My punishment was justified.

15.Abdul Hye: These people wait nothing but only for a single shout; it has no pause of ending

16.Abdul Hye: They say: “Our Lord! Hasten to us our account (of deeds) before the Day of reckoning!”

17.Abdul Hye: Be patient (O Muhammad) on what they say, and remember Our servant David, gifted with power. Surely, he was often turning in repentance (toward Allah).

18.Abdul Hye: Surely, We made the mountains to glorify Our praises with him (David) in the evening and after sunrise.

19.Abdul Hye: All the birds too assembled with him (David)

20.Abdul Hye: We made his kingdom strong and gave him wisdom and sound judgment in speech (decision).

21.Abdul Hye: Has the news of the 2 litigants (engaged in lawsuit) reached you when they climbed over the chamber (into his praying place)?

22.Abdul Hye: When they entered in upon David, he was terrified of them. They said: “Don’t fear! We are 2 litigants; one of us has wronged on the other, therefore judge between us with truth, and not be unjust, and guide us to the Right Way.

23.Abdul Hye: Surely, this is my brother (in religion), he has 99 ewes (female sheep), while I have only one ewe. Yet he says: ‘Hand it over to me, and he overpowered me in speech.’”

24.Abdul Hye: (David) said (without listening to the opponent): “He indeed has wronged you in demanding your ewe to his ewes. Surely, many partners oppress one on another, except those who believe and do righteous deeds, and they are few.” (While saying this) David realized that We have tested him, he sought forgiveness of his Lord, he fell down prostrate, and turned (to Allah) in repentance.

25.Abdul Hye: So We forgave him. Surely, for him is a near access to Us and a good place of return (Paradise).

26.Abdul Hye: (Allah said): “O David! Surely! We have placed you as a vicegerent on the earth, so judge between people with justice and don’t follow your desire, for it will mislead you from the Way of Allah. Surely! Those who wander astray from the Way of Allah, they shall have a severe punishment, because they forgot the Day of Reckoning.

27.Abdul Hye: And We did not create the heaven and the earth and all that is between them without purpose! That is the consideration of those who disbelieve! Then woe to those who disbelieve from the fire!

28.Abdul Hye: Or should We treat those who believe and do righteous deeds like those who are mischief-makers on earth? Or should We treat the pious as criminals?

29.Abdul Hye: This is a book (the Qur’an) which We have sent down to you (O Muhammad), full of blessings so that they may ponder over its Verses and men of understanding may learn.

30.Abdul Hye: And We granted Solomon to David. How excellent a devotee! Surely, he was often turning in repentance (to Us)!

31.Abdul Hye: When the well-trained horses of the highest breed (for Allah’s Cause) were displayed before him in one evening

32.Abdul Hye: and he said: “Surely I did love the good (of these horses) instead of remembering my Lord (in my Asr prayer),” till the time was over, and the sun had hidden in the veil (of night),

33.Abdul Hye: (then he said): “Bring them (horses) back to me.” Then he began to pass his hand over their legs and their necks (with affection).

34.Abdul Hye: And indeed, We did test Solomon and We placed on his throne a body (a devil, so he lost his kingdom for a while), then he did return (to Allah with repentance, and to his throne by the Grace of Allah).

35.Abdul Hye: He said: “My Lord! Forgive me, and bestow upon me a kingdom such as shall not be given to anyone after me. Surely, You are the Bestower.”

36.Abdul Hye: So, We (accepted his prayer and)  subjected to him the wind, it blew gently to his order wherever he willed,

37.Abdul Hye: and also the devils from the jinns with every kind of builder and diver

38.Abdul Hye: and also others bound in fetters.

39.Abdul Hye: (Allah said to Solomon): “This is Our gift, so you spend or withhold, no account will be asked.”

40.Abdul Hye: Surely, he has a place of nearness to Us and will have a good final return (Paradise).

41.Abdul Hye: And remember Our devotee Job, when he invoked his Lord (saying): “Surely! Satan has afflicted me with distress (by losing my health) and suffering (by losing my wealth).”

42.Abdul Hye: (Allah said to him): “Strike (the ground) with your foot: This is (a spring of water) to wash in, cool and drink.”

43.Abdul Hye: And We gave him back his family, and the like thereof along with them as a Mercy from Us, and a reminder for those who understand.

44.Abdul Hye: (Allah said): “Take a bundle of branches (thin grass) in your hand and strike with it (your wife to fulfill your oath of 100 strikes which was made during sickness), and don’t break your oath.” Truly! We found him patient. How excellent is the devotee! Surely, he was often turning in repentance (to Us)!

45.Abdul Hye: And remember Our devotees, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, all owners of strength (in worship) and also of religious understanding.

46.Abdul Hye: Surely, We chose them by granting them a good thing, the remembrance of the home (of Hereafter)

47.Abdul Hye: Surely, they are with Us, of those chosen and the best!

48.Abdul Hye: Remember Ishmael, Elisha, and Isaiah, and all were among the best.

49.Abdul Hye: This is a reminder (the Qur’an), and surely, for those pious people there is a good final return (Paradise).

50.Abdul Hye: The everlasting (Eden) gardens whose doors will be open for them.

51.Abdul Hye: They will recline in it, they will call for fruits in abundance and drinks;

52.Abdul Hye: and with them will be chaste females (virgins) restraining their glances (only for their husbands), equal in age.

53.Abdul Hye: This is what you (the pious) are promised for the Day of reckoning,

54.Abdul Hye: surely, this is Our Provision which will never finish.

55.Abdul Hye: This is so! Surely for the transgressors, an evil will be return,

56.Abdul Hye: hell! where they will burn, and worst is that place to rest!

57.Abdul Hye: This is so! Then let them taste it, a boiling fluid and dirty wound discharges

58.Abdul Hye: and other (punishments) of similar kind, (all together) in pairs!

59.Abdul Hye: (The misguided leaders will be told): “This is a troop entering with you (in hell), no welcome for them! Surely, they will burn in the fire!”

60.Abdul Hye: (The followers of the misguided leaders will say): “Nay, you too! No welcome for you! It is you (leaders) who brought this upon us. Such an evil is this place to stay in!”

61.Abdul Hye: They will say: “Our Lord! Those who brought this upon us, add to them double punishment in the fire!”

62.Abdul Hye: They will say (to each other): “What is the matter with us that we don’t see those people whom we used to count among the bad ones

63.Abdul Hye: Did we take them as an object of mockery, or our eyes failed to perceive them?”

64.Abdul Hye: Surely, that is the very truth: the people of the fire will have mutual dispute (common habit)!

65.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “I am only a Warner and there is no one worthy of worship except Allah, the One, the Irresistible,

66.Abdul Hye: the Lord of the heavens and the earth and all that is between them, the Mighty, the Forgiving.”

67.Abdul Hye: Say: “That (the Qur’an) is a great news,

68.Abdul Hye: from which you turn away!”

69.Abdul Hye: (Say): “I had no knowledge of the exalted chiefs (angels) when they disputed (about the creation of Adam).

70.Abdul Hye: This is inspired to me with that I am only a plain Warner.”

71.Abdul Hye: (Remember) when your Lord said to the angels: “Surely, I am going to create a man from clay,

72.Abdul Hye: so when I have fashioned him and breathed into him (his soul) from me, then you fall down to him and prostrate.”

73.Abdul Hye: So the angels prostrated, all of them together,

74.Abdul Hye: except Satan, he was proud and was one of the disbelievers.

75.Abdul Hye: (Allah) said: “O Satan! What prevents you from prostrating to one whom I have created with My own hands? Are you too proud or are you of the high exalted?”

76.Abdul Hye: (Satan) said: “I am better than he, You created me from fire, and You created him from clay.”

77.Abdul Hye: (Allah) said: “Then get out from here, for surely, you are accursed,

78.Abdul Hye: and surely! My curse shall be on you till the Day of recompense.”

79.Abdul Hye: (Satan) said: “My Lord! Then give me respite till the Day is resurrected.”

80.Abdul Hye: (Allah) said: “Surely! You are of those allowed respite

81.Abdul Hye: till the Day of the time appointed.”

82.Abdul Hye: (Satan) said: “By Your might, I will surely mislead them all,

83.Abdul Hye: except Your chosen (faithful) devotees amongst them.”

84.Abdul Hye: (Allah) said: “Then the truth, and the truth I say,

85.Abdul Hye: that I will fill hell with you (Satan) and those of them (mankind) who follow you, all.”

86.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “I ask you no wage for this (the Qur’an), nor am I one of the fakers (imposters).

87.Abdul Hye: It (this Qur’an) is nothing but a reminder for all (worlds),

88.Abdul Hye: and you shall certainly know its news after a while.”

1.Abdul Hye: The revelation of this book (the Qur’an) is from Allah, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

2.Abdul Hye: Surely, We have sent down the book to you (O Muhammad) in truth. So worship Allah (alone) sincerely, the religion is for Allah.

3.Abdul Hye: Surely, the religion is completely for Allah (alone). Those who take protectors besides Him (say): “We worship them only so that they may bring us near to Allah.” Surely, Allah will judge between them concerning that in which they differ. Truly, Allah does not guide the one who is a liar, and a disbeliever.

4.Abdul Hye: Had Allah willed to take a son, He could have chosen anyone of those whom He has created and with whom He is pleased. But glory be to Him! Allah is the One, the Irresistible.

5.Abdul Hye: He has created the heavens and the earth with the truth. He makes the night overtake the day and makes the day overtake the night. He has subjected the sun and the moon, each is running for an appointed term. Surely, He is the All-Mighty, the Forgiving.

6.Abdul Hye: He has created you all from a single person (Adam); then made his wife (Eve) from him. He has sent down for you of cattle 8 in pairs. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, creation after creation in 3 layers of darkness. Such is Allah, your Lord. The kingdom belongs to Him; there is no one worthy of worship but He. How can you then turn away?

7.Abdul Hye: If you disbelieve, then surely (know that), Allah does not need you. He does not like disbelief from His servants. If you are grateful (believer), He is pleased with you. No bearer of burdens shall bear the burden of another. Then your return is to your Lord. So He will inform you what you did. Surely, He is the All-Knower of that which is in the hearts.

8.Abdul Hye: And when some trouble touches people, they cry to their Lord, turning to Him in repentance. But when He bestows a Favor upon them from Him, they forget what they had supplicated (cried) to Him before, and they set up rivals to Allah in order to mislead others from His Way. Say: “Take pleasure in your disbelief for a while. Surely, you will be one of the inmates of the fire!”

9.Abdul Hye: Can the one who is obedient to Allah, prostrating or standing (in prayer) during the Hours of the night, fearing the Hereafter and hoping for the Mercy of the Lord (be compared with a disbeliever)? Say: “Are those who know equal to those who don’t know?” It is only people of understanding who will remember.

10.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “O My servants who believe, be afraid of your Lord and keep your duty (to Him). Good reward is for those who do good in this world, and Allah’s earth is spacious (if you cannot worship Allah at a place, then go to another)! Only those who are patient shall receive their rewards without reckoning.”

11.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “Surely, I am commanded to worship Allah sincerely doing the religious deeds for Him

12.Abdul Hye: and I am commanded in order to be the first of those who submit themselves to Allah as Muslims.”

13.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “Surely, if I disobey my Lord, I am afraid of the punishment of a great Day.”

14.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “I worship by doing my religion sincerely for His sake.”

15.Abdul Hye: So worship what you like besides Him. Say (O Muhammad): “Surely, the losers are those who will lose themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection. Surely, that will be a clear loss!”

16.Abdul Hye: They shall have coverings of fire from above them and coverings (of fire) beneath them; so that with this Allah frightens His servants: “O My servants, therefore, fear Me!”

17.Abdul Hye: Those who avoid false deities by not worshipping them and turn to Allah in repentance, there are glad tidings for them. So announce (O Muhammad) the good news to My servants,

18.Abdul Hye: those who listen to the Word (to worship Allah) and follow the best thereof. Such are the ones whom Allah has guided and such are the people of understanding

19.Abdul Hye: Is the one against whom the word of punishment is justified (equal to the one who avoids evil)? Can you rescue the one who is in the fire?

20.Abdul Hye: But those who fear their Lord, for them lofty rooms are built one above another, with flowing rivers under them (Paradise). This is the Promise of Allah and Allah does not fail in (His) Promise.

21.Abdul Hye: Don’t you see that Allah sends down water (rain) from the sky, and it penetrates in the earth and comes out as water-springs? Afterwards produces crops of different colors, then they wither and you see them turn yellow, and then He makes them dry and broken pieces. Surely, in this, there is a reminder for people of understanding.

22.Abdul Hye: Is the one whose heart Allah has opened to Islam and is in light from its Lord (same as one who disbelieves)? So woe to those whose hearts are hardened against remembrance of Allah! They are in plain error!

23.Abdul Hye: Allah has sent down the best statement, a book (this Qur’an), its parts resemble each other, often repeated. The skins of those who fear their Lord shiver from it. Then their skins and their hearts soften to the remembrance of Allah. Such is the guidance of Allah. He guides whom He pleases and whomever He sends astray, there is no guide for him.

24.Abdul Hye: Is the one who will confront with the awful punishment on the Day of Resurrection (same as one who enters peacefully into Paradise)? It will be said to the wrongdoers: “Taste what you earned!”

25.Abdul Hye: Those who also denied before them, the punishment came on them from where they did not perceive.

26.Abdul Hye: So Allah made them to taste the disgrace in the present life, but the punishment of the Hereafter is greater if they only knew!

27.Abdul Hye: And indeed We have put forth every kind of example for mankind in this Qur’an in order that they may remember.

28.Abdul Hye: It is an Arabic Qur’an without any crookedness (flaw) in it in order that they may avoid all evil.

29.Abdul Hye: Allah puts forth an example: a captive belongs to many partners disputing with one another (like one who believes in many false deities), and a captive belongs entirely to one master (like one believes in one Allah). Are these 2 equal in comparison? All the praise be to Allah! But most of them don’t know.

30.Abdul Hye: Surely, you (O Muhammad) will die and surely, they too will die.

31.Abdul Hye: Then surely on the Day of Resurrection, you will dispute (to settle) before your Lord.

32.Abdul Hye: Who is worse than one who utters a lie against Allah, and denies the truth when it comes to him? Is there not an abode in hell for the disbelievers?

33.Abdul Hye: And the one who brings the truth and believes in it - they are those who are the pious people.

34.Abdul Hye: They shall have all that they will desire from their Lord. That is the reward of the righteous people

35.Abdul Hye: Allah will expiate their evil deeds from them and give them the reward according to their best deeds.

36.Abdul Hye: Is Allah not sufficient for His servants? Yet they try to frighten you with those besides Him! The one whom Allah sends astray, there is no guide for him.

37.Abdul Hye: And the one whom Allah guides, there is none to mislead him. Is not Allah the Mighty, the Possessor of Retribution?

38.Abdul Hye: And surely, if you ask them: “Who created the heavens and the earth?” Surely, they will say: “Allah.” Say: “Do you see the things that you invoke besides Allah, if Allah intends some harm for me, could they remove His harm, or if He intends some Mercy for me, could they withhold His Mercy?" Say: “Allah is sufficient for me. Those who trust in Him, must put their trust.”

39.Abdul Hye: Say: (O Muhammad): “O my people! Work according to your way, surely I am working (according to my way). Then you will come to know,

40.Abdul Hye: to whom a disgracing punishment will come, and on whom an everlasting punishment will descend.”

41.Abdul Hye: Surely, We have sent down to you (O Muhammad) the book (this Qur’an) for mankind in truth. So those who accept the guidance, it is only for their own self, and those who go astray, they go astray only to their own loss. You (O Muhammad) are not a trustee over them.

42.Abdul Hye: It is Allah who takes away the souls at the time of their death, and those that don’t die during their sleep. He keeps those souls for which He has ordained death and sends the rest for an appointed term. Surely, in that there are signs for people who think deeply.

43.Abdul Hye: Have they taken others besides Allah as intercessors? Ask: “(How can they intercede) if they don’t possess anything and have no intelligence?”

44.Abdul Hye: Say: “All intercession belongs to Allah. The sovereignty of the heavens and the earth is with Him, and to Him you all shall be brought back.”
