22.Abdul Hye: You (O Muhammad) will never find any people who believe in Allah and the Last Day on friendly terms with those who oppose Allah and His Messenger (Muhammad), even though they are their fathers, or their sons, or their brothers, or their kindred (people). For such He has written faith in their hearts and has strengthened them with spirit (true guidance) from Himself. And He will admit them to Gardens (Paradise) under which rivers flow, to reside in it forever. Allah will be pleased with them, and they will be pleased with Him. They are the party of Allah. Lo! Surely it is the party of Allah that will be the successful.

1.Abdul Hye: Glorifies Allah whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Allah is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

2.Abdul Hye: It is He Who drove out those who disbelieve from the people of the Scripture (the Jews of Bani An-Nadheer) from their homes at the first gathering. You did not think that they would ever get out. They thought that their fortresses would defend them from Allah! But Allah’s (punishment) reached them from a place where from they did not expect it, and He cast fear into their hearts, so that they destroyed their own homes with their own hands and by the hands of the believers. So take admonition, O you with eyes (to see).

3.Abdul Hye: And had it not been that Allah had decreed exile for them, He would certainly have punished them in this world, and in the Hereafter they shall have the punishment of the fire.

4.Abdul Hye: That is because they opposed Allah and His Messenger (Muhammad). Whoever opposes Allah, then surely Allah is Severe in punishment.

5.Abdul Hye: Whatever palm-trees (of the enemy) you (O Muslims) cut down or left them standing on their roots, it was by the permission of Allah, so that He might disgrace the transgressors.

6.Abdul Hye: And what Allah gave as booty to His Messenger (Muhammad) from them, you made no expedition for that with either cavalry or riding-camel. But Allah gives power to His Messenger over whoever He wills. And Allah has power over all things.

7.Abdul Hye: Whatever Allah gave as booty to His Messenger (Muhammad) from the people of the townships, it is for Allah, His Messenger (Muhammad), the kindred (relatives of Messenger), the orphans, the poor, and the wayfarer; so that it may not become a fortune between the rich among you. Whatever the Messenger (Muhammad) gives you, take it and whatever he forbids you, abstain from it, and fear Allah. Surely, Allah is Severe in punishment.

8.Abdul Hye: (There is share in this booty) for the poor emigrants who were expelled from their homes and their property, and are seeking Bounties from Allah and pleasure (of Him). This is helping Allah (in His religion) and His Messenger (Muhammad). They are indeed the true believers.

9.Abdul Hye: (Share of booty given to) those who had homes (Ansars in Madinah) and had faith before (the arrival of) them (emigrants) and love those who emigrated to them and they had no jealousy in their hearts for things given (from the booty) to them, and prefer them (emigrants) over themselves, even though they themselves were in need of that. Those who are saved from their enviousness, such are they who will be the successful.

10.Abdul Hye: And those who came after them say: “Our Lord! Forgive us and our brothers who have preceded us in faith and don’t put any hatred in our hearts against those who have believed. Our Lord! You are indeed full of Kindness, Merciful.”

11.Abdul Hye: Have you (O Muhammad) not observed those who were hypocrites? They say to their fellow disbelievers among the people of the Scripture: “If you are expelled, we indeed will go out with you. We will never obey anyone against you. Even if you are attacked, we will indeed help you.” But Allah is witness that surely they are liars.

12.Abdul Hye: Surely, if they (people of the book) are expelled, they (hypocrites) will never go out with them, and if they are attacked, they will never help them. Even if they help them, they (hypocrites) will turn their backs; so they will not be victorious.

13.Abdul Hye: Surely, you (believers) are more fearful in their (Jews of An-Nadir) hearts than of Allah. That is because they are a people who don’t comprehend (power of Allah).

14.Abdul Hye: They will never fight against you together except in fortified townships or from behind walls. Their enmity among themselves is very strong. You think them as united but their hearts are divided. This is because they are a people who don’t understand.

15.Abdul Hye: They are like their immediate predecessors (Jews of Bani Qainuqa); they tasted the evil result of their deeds, for them will be a painful torment.

16.Abdul Hye: They are like Satan who says to human: “Disbelieve.” So when human disbelieves, Satan says: “I am free of you, I fear Allah, the Lord of the worlds!”

17.Abdul Hye: So the end of both will be that they will be in the fire, abiding in it forever. That is the recompense of the wrongdoers.

18.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Fear Allah and let every person look to what it has sent forth for tomorrow (Hereafter), and fear Allah. Surely, Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

19.Abdul Hye: And be not like those who forgot Allah and He caused them to forget their own selves. Those are the transgressors.

20.Abdul Hye: Not equal are the inmates of the fire and the residents of the Paradise. It is the residents of Paradise, they will be successful.

21.Abdul Hye: If We had sent down this Qur’an on a mountain, you would have seen it humbling itself and split asunder from the fear of Allah. Such are the examples which We put forward to mankind so that they may reflect.

22.Abdul Hye: He is Allah, besides Whom there is no one worthy of worship but He, the Knower of the unseen and the seen. He is the Beneficent, the Merciful.

23.Abdul Hye: He is Allah besides Whom there is no one worthy of worship but He, the King, the Holy, the one free from all defects, the Giver of security, the Watcher over His creatures, the Mighty, the Compeller, the Supreme. Glory be to Allah above all that they associate as partners with Him.

24.Abdul Hye: He is Allah, the Creator, the Inventor of all things, and the Bestower of forms. To Him belongs the best names. All that are in the heavens and the earth glorify Him. And He is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

60.SurahEnglishNames: She That is to be Examined, Examining her, She Who is Tested

1.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Don’t take My enemies and your enemies (disbelievers) as friends. Would you show affection towards them, when they have disbelieved in what has come to you of the truth (Islam) and have driven out the Messenger (Muhammad) and yourselves (from your homeland), simply because you believe in Allah, your Lord? If you have come forth to strive in My Cause and to seek My good pleasure, then how can you show friendship to them in secret? I am aware of what you conceal and what you reveal. And whoever of you (Muslims) does that, then indeed has gone astray from the Right Way.

2.Abdul Hye: If they gain the upper hand over you, they would behave to you as enemies and stretch out their hands and their tongues against you with evil, and they wish that you should become disbelievers.

3.Abdul Hye: On the Day of Resurrection, neither your relatives nor your children will benefit you. He will judge between you. Allah sees all of what you do.

4.Abdul Hye: Indeed an excellent example has been set for you in Abraham and those with him. When they said to their people: “Surely, we are free from you and whatever you worship besides Allah. We reject you. Hostility and hatred shall appear between us and between you forever until you believe in Allah alone.” Except the saying of Abraham to his father: “Surely, I will ask for forgiveness (from Allah) for you, but I have no power to get anything for you from Allah.” (They prayed): “Our Lord! In You (alone) we put our trust, to You (alone) we turn in repentance, and to You (alone) is the final return.

5.Abdul Hye: Our Lord! Don’t make us a trial for those who disbelieve, and forgive us. Our Lord! Surely You are the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.”

6.Abdul Hye: Surely, there is an excellent example for you in them to follow for those who look forward to (the meeting with) Allah and the Last Day. Whoever turns away, then surely, Allah is Rich (free of all wants), Praise-Worthy.

7.Abdul Hye: Perhaps that Allah will make friendship among them between you and between those with whom you hold as enemies. And Allah has power (over all things), and Allah is Forgiving, the Merciful.

8.Abdul Hye: Allah does not forbid you to deal kindly and justly with those who had neither fought against you on account of religion nor drove you out of your homes. Surely, Allah loves those who deal with equity.

9.Abdul Hye: Allah only forbids you to befriend them as to those who fought against you on account of religion, drove you out of your homes, and helped to drive you out. Whoever will befriend them, such are the wrongdoers

10.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! When the believing women come to you as emigrants, examine them. Allah knows best as to their faith. If you ascertain that they are true believers, don’t send them back to the disbelievers. They are not lawful (wives) for them (disbelievers), nor are they (disbelievers) lawful (husbands) for them. But give them (disbelievers) that (amount of money) which they have spent (as their dowries) to them. There is no sin on you to marry them if you pay them their dowries. Likewise don’t hold the disbelieving women as wives. Ask for (the return of) that which you have spent (as dowry) and let them (disbelievers) ask back for what they have spent. This is the judgment of Allah. He judges between you. And Allah is All-Knower, All-Wise.

11.Abdul Hye: And if any of your wives have gone from you to the disbelievers (and afterwards you have your turn (of triumph)) and you have an investment (by the coming over of a woman from the disbelief), then pay to those whose wives have gone, the equivalent of what they had spent (on their dowry). Fear Allah, in whom you believe.

12.Abdul Hye: O Prophet! When the believing women come to you to give you the pledge that they will not associate anything in worship with Allah, that they will not steal, that they will not commit illegal sexual intercourse, that they will not kill their children, that they will not utter slander, that they will not forge between their hands and their feet (falsehood by accusing another women of having illicit relationship with a man or making illegal children and making husband believe that it belongs to her husband), they will not disobey you in any just matter (permitted by Islam), then accept their pledge, and ask Allah to forgive them. Surely, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

13.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Don’t take as friends the people who incurred upon them the Wrath of Allah. Surely, they have despaired from (any good) in the Hereafter, just as the disbelievers have despaired from the people of the graves (buried).

1.Abdul Hye: Glorifies Allah whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Allah is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

2.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Why do you say that which you don’t do?

3.Abdul Hye: It is most hateful with Allah that you say that which you don’t do.

4.Abdul Hye: Surely, Allah loves those who fight in His cause in rows (ranks in battle) as if they were a solid structure.

5.Abdul Hye: And (remember) when Moses said to his people: “O my people! Why do you hurt me while certainly you know that I am the Messenger of Allah to you?” So when they turned away (from Allah), Allah turned away their hearts (from the Right Way). And Allah does not guide those who are transgressors.

6.Abdul Hye: And (remember) when Jesus, son of Mary, said: “O Children of Israel! I am the Messenger of Allah to you, confirming the Torah which came before me, and give you glad tidings of a Messenger that will come after me whose name shall be Ahmed (another name of Muhammad, meaning ‘The praised one’).” But when he (Muhammad) came to them with clear proofs, they said: “This is plain magic.”

7.Abdul Hye: Who does more wrong than the one who invents a lie against Allah while he is being invited to Islam? And Allah does not guide the people of wrongdoers.

8.Abdul Hye: They intend to put out the Light of Allah (of Islam) with their mouths. But Allah will perfect His Light even though the disbelievers hate it.

9.Abdul Hye: It is He Who has sent His Messenger (Muhammad) with guidance and the religion of truth (Islam) to make it victorious over all other religions even though the polytheists hate it.

10.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Shall I guide you to a commerce that will save you from a painful punishment?

11.Abdul Hye: You believe in Allah and His Messenger (Muhammad), and that you strive hard, and fight in the cause of Allah with your wealth and your lives. That will be better for you, if you but know!

12.Abdul Hye: (If you do so) He will forgive you your sins and admit you into gardens under which rivers flow, and pleasant residences in gardens of Eden (eternity) (Paradise), that is the great success.

13.Abdul Hye: And also (He will give you) another blessing which you love, help from Allah (against your enemies) and a near victory. So give glad tidings (O Muhammad) to the believers.

14.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Be the helpers (in the Cause) of Allah, just as Jesus, son of Mary, said to the disciples: “Who will be my helpers (in the cause) of Allah?” The disciples said: “We are helpers of Allah.” Then a group of the children of Israel believed and a group disbelieved. So Allah gave power to those who believed against their enemies, and they became the uppermost.

62.SurahEnglishNames: The Congregation, Friday, The Day of Congregation

1.Abdul Hye: Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth glorifies Allah, the King, the Holy, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

2.Abdul Hye: It is He Who has sent among the unlettered people, a Messenger (Muhammad) from among themselves, who recites to them His revelations, purifies them (from disbelief), and teaches them the book (this Qur’an) and wisdom, even though they were in clear error before,

3.Abdul Hye: and also to others among them (Muslims) who have not yet joined them. Allah is the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

4.Abdul Hye: That is the Grace of Allah, which He bestows on whom He wills. And Allah is the Owner of Mighty Grace.

5.Abdul Hye: The likeness of those who were entrusted with the Torah (to obey its commandments), but they failed it (those obligations), is as the likeness of a donkey who carries huge burdens of books (but understands nothing). How bad is the example of people who deny the Verses of Allah? And Allah does not guide the wrongdoers.

6.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “O you who are Jews! If you claim that you are friends of Allah to the exclusion of all other people, then wish for death if you are truthful.”

7.Abdul Hye: But they will never wish for it (death), because of what deeds their hands have sent before them! Allah knows well the wrongdoers.

8.Abdul Hye: Say (to them): “Surely, the death from which you flee, will surely meet you, then you will be sent back to (Allah) the All-Knower of the unseen and the seen, and He will tell you what you used to do.”

9.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! When the call is proclaimed for the prayer on Friday, then hasten to the remembrance of Allah and leave off business. That is better for you if you did but know!

10.Abdul Hye: When the (Jumu’ah) prayer is finished, you may disperse in the land and seek the Grace of Allah (by working). Remember Allah much so that you may be successful.

11.Abdul Hye: And when they (people with weak faith) see some merchandise or some amusement, they disperse headlong to it, and leave you (Muhammad) standing (while you are delivering Jumu’ah religious talk). Say: “That which Allah has is better than any amusement or merchandise! Allah is the Best of providers.”

1.Abdul Hye: When the hypocrites come to you (O Muhammad), they say: “We bear witness that you are indeed the Messenger of Allah.” Allah knows that you are indeed His Messenger and Allah bears witness that the hypocrites are indeed liars.

2.Abdul Hye: They have taken their oaths as a shield (for their hypocrisy). Thus they hinder people from the Way of Allah. Surely, evil is what they do.

3.Abdul Hye: This is because they believed, then disbelieved. Their hearts are sealed, so they don’t understand.

4.Abdul Hye: When you look at them, their good look pleases you; and when they speak, you listen to their words. Yet, they are as blocks of wood propped up (worthless). They think that every cry is against them. They are the enemies, so beware of them. May Allah curse them! How are they deviated!

5.Abdul Hye: When it is said to them: “Come, so that the Messenger of Allah will ask forgiveness from Allah for you,” they turn aside their heads and you see them turning away (their faces) while they are in pride.

6.Abdul Hye: It is equal to them whether you (Muhammad) ask forgiveness for them or don’t ask forgiveness for them. Allah will not forgive them. Surely, Allah does not guide the people who are disobedient.

7.Abdul Hye: They are the ones who say: “Don’t spend on those who are with the Messenger of Allah, until they desert him.” To Allah belongs the treasures of the heavens and the earth, but the hypocrites don’t comprehend.

8.Abdul Hye: They (hypocrites) say: “If we return to Madinah, indeed the more honorable (Abdullah bin Ubai bin Salul, the chief hypocrite at Madinah) will expel from there the meaner (Allah’s Messenger).” But honor, power and glory belong to Allah, and to His Messenger (Muhammad), and to the believers, but the hypocrites don’t know.

9.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Let neither your properties nor your children distract you from the remembrance of Allah. Those who will do so, then they are the real losers.

10.Abdul Hye: Spend (in charity) of that which We have provided you before death comes to one of you who says: “My Lord! If only You would give me respite for a little while (return to the worldly life), then I would give in charity, and be among the righteous.”

11.Abdul Hye: And Allah never grants respite to a soul when its appointed time (death) comes to an end. Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

1.Abdul Hye: Glorifies Allah whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. The dominion is His, to Him belong all the praises and thanks, He has power over all things.

2.Abdul Hye: It is He Who created you; yet, some of you are disbelievers and some of you are believers. And Allah is All-Seer of what you do.

3.Abdul Hye: He has created the heavens and the earth with the truth. He has shaped you and shaped you well, and to Him is the final return.

4.Abdul Hye: He knows what is in the heavens and the earth. He knows what you conceal and what you reveal. Allah is All-Knower of what is in the hearts.

5.Abdul Hye: Has not the news reached you of those who disbelieved before? So they tasted the evil result of their disbelief, and there will be a painful punishment (in the Hereafter) for them.

6.Abdul Hye: That is because, when their Messengers came to them with clear proofs, they said: “Shall simple human guide us?” So they disbelieved and turned away (from truth). But Allah is not in need (of them). And Allah is Rich (free of all wants), Praise-worthy.

7.Abdul Hye: The disbelievers claim that they will never be resurrected (to account). Say (O Muhammad): “Yes! By my Lord, you will certainly be resurrected, you will be informed of what you did, that is easy for Allah.”

8.Abdul Hye: Therefore, believe in Allah and His Messenger (Muhammad), and in the light (this Qur’an) which We have sent down. And Allah is All-Aware of what you do.

9.Abdul Hye: (And remember) the Day when He will gather you all on the Day of gathering, that will be the Day of mutual loss and gain. Those who believe in Allah and perform righteous deeds, He will remit from them their sins and will admit them to gardens under which rivers flow (Paradise), they will reside in it forever; that will be the great success.

10.Abdul Hye: But those who disbelieved and denied Our revelations, they will be the inmates of the fire, they will reside in it forever, and worst is that destination.

11.Abdul Hye: No calamity can ever befall except by the permission of Allah. Whoever believes in Allah, He guides its heart (to the truth). And Allah is All-Knower of everything.

12.Abdul Hye: Obey Allah and obey the Messenger (Muhammad). But if you turn away, then (know that the duty) of Our Messenger is only to convey (the message) clearly.

13.Abdul Hye: Allah! There is no one worthy of worship but He, and in Allah let the believers put their trust.

14.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Surely, among your wives and your children there are enemies (who may stop you from the obedience of Allah) for you; so beware of them! But if you pardon them, overlook, and forgive (their faults), then surely, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

15.Abdul Hye: Your wealth and your children are only a trial. With Allah there is a great reward (Paradise).

16.Abdul Hye: So, fear Allah as much as you can, listen (to His message) and obey, and spend in charity, that is better for you. And those who are saved from their own enviousness, it is they who are the successful ones.

17.Abdul Hye: If you lend to Allah a goodly loan (spend in His Cause), He will double it for you, and will forgive you. And Allah is Appreciative, Forbearing,

18.Abdul Hye: Knows all of the unseen and seen, the All-Mighty, the All-Wise.

1.Abdul Hye: O Prophet (Muhammad)! When you (the believers) divorce women, divorce them at (end of) their prescribed (waiting) periods, and count their periods (correctly). Fear Allah, your Lord. Don’t turn them out from their (husband’s) homes (waiting period), nor they should leave (themselves), unless they have committed adultery openly. These are the limits of Allah. Whoever transgresses the limits of Allah, then indeed has wronged itself. You (one who divorces wife) never know, Allah may bring something new (situation) after that (reconciliation for her return back to you).

2.Abdul Hye: Then, when they have fulfilled their appointed term (waiting period ends), either take them back in a good manner or part with them in a good manner. Take for witness 2 honest persons among you (Muslims), and establish the witness for Allah. This advice is given to all who believe in Allah and the Last Day. And whoever fears Allah, He makes a way out for him (from difficulty),

3.Abdul Hye: and He provides him sustenance from (sources) where he could never imagine. Whoever puts its trust in Allah, then He is sufficient for him. Surely, Allah accomplishes what He pleases. Indeed Allah has set a measure for every thing.

4.Abdul Hye: Those of your women who have passed the monthly periods (of menstruation), if you have doubts in their prescribed period, it is 3 months (of waiting), and (same period apply) for those who don’t have periods (young age or diseased). For those who are pregnant (whether they are divorced or their husbands are dead), their waiting period is until they deliver their burdens. Those who fear Allah; He will make their matters easy for them.

5.Abdul Hye: This is the Command of Allah which He has sent down to you. Those who fear Allah, He will remit their sins from them and will enlarge rewards for them.

6.Abdul Hye: Let them (divorced women during their waiting period) live where you yourself live according to your means. You don’t harm them so as to straiten them (make their life intolerable and leave your house). If they are pregnant, then spend on them till they deliver their burden. Then if they give suck (to the children) for you, then give them their due payment (compensation), and let each of you accept the advice of the other between you in a just way. But if you make difficulties for one another, then some other woman may give suck for you (father of the child).

7.Abdul Hye: Let the rich people spend according to their means, and the people whose resources are restricted (poor), let them spend according to what Allah has given them. Allah does not put burden on any person beyond what He has given him. Allah will grant ease after hardship.

8.Abdul Hye: Many townships revolted against the Command of their Lord and His Messengers. We called them to a severe account (punishment in worldly life) and We shall punish them with a horrible punishment (Hereafter).

9.Abdul Hye: So they tasted the evil result of their misdeeds and the consequence of their misdeeds was loss (destruction in this life and punishment in the Hereafter).

10.Abdul Hye: Allah has prepared for them a severe punishment (in the Hereafter). So fear Allah, O men of understanding who have believed! Indeed Allah has sent down to you a reminder (this Qur’an);

11.Abdul Hye: (And also sent to you) a Messenger (Muhammad), who recites to you the Verses of Allah (the Qur’an) with clear explanations, so that He may take out those who believe and do righteous deeds from the darkness (of polytheism) to the light (of faith). Those who believe in Allah and perform righteous deeds, He will admit them into gardens under which rivers flow (Paradise), they will reside in it forever. Indeed Allah has granted an excellent provision for them.

12.Abdul Hye: It is Allah Who has created 7 heavens and of the earth like them. His Command descends between them (heavens and earth), so that you may know that Allah has power over all things and that Allah indeed surrounds all things in (His) knowledge.

1.Abdul Hye: O Prophet! Why do you make unlawful (for yourself) which Allah has made lawful to you in seeking the pleasure of your wives? And Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

2.Abdul Hye: Allah has already ordained for you (Muslims) the absolution from your oaths. And Allah is your Master and He is the All-Knower, the All-Wise.

3.Abdul Hye: And (remember) when the prophet (Muhammad) disclosed a matter (secret) to one of his wives (Hafsa), she disclosed it (to Aisha). And Allah made it known to him; he informed part of it (to Aisha) and left a part. Then when he told her (Hafsa) of it, she said: “Who told you this?” He said: “The All-Knower, the All-Aware (Allah) has told me.”

4.Abdul Hye: If you both (Aisha and Hafsa) turn in repentance to Allah (it will be better) as your hearts have indeed so inclined (to oppose what the prophet likes); but if you help one another against him (Muhammad), then surely (know that) Allah is his Protector, Gabriel, and the righteous (among) the believers, and furthermore, the angels too are his helpers.

5.Abdul Hye: It may well be that, if he divorces you all, his Lord will give him wives better than you in exchange: Muslims, believers, obedient (to Allah), turn to Allah in repentance, worshippers, (who are) fasting or emigrating (for Allah’s sake), previously married and virgins.

6.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Save yourselves and your families against a fire (hell) whose fuel is people and stones, over which angels are appointed who are stern and severe, who don’t disobey the Commandments they receive from Allah, but do what they are commanded.

7.Abdul Hye: (It will be said in the Hereafter): “O you who disbelieve! Don’t make excuses this Day! You are being requited only for what you used to do.”

8.Abdul Hye: O you who believe! Turn to Allah with sincere repentance! It may well be that your Lord will remit your sins from you and admit you into gardens under which rivers flow (Paradise). On that Day, Allah will not disgrace the prophet (Muhammad) and those who believe with him. Their light will run before them and (their record of deeds) in their Right Hands, they will say: “Our Lord! Keep our light perfect for us and grant us forgiveness. Surely, Allah has power over all things.”

9.Abdul Hye: O Prophet (Muhammad)! Strive hard against the disbelievers and the hypocrites and be severe against them. Their abode will be hell and worst indeed is that destination.

10.Abdul Hye: Allah has set forth an example for the disbelievers: the wife of Noah and the wife of Lot. They were under 2 of Allah’s righteous servants, but they both betrayed them (husbands by rejecting their doctrine). So they (Noah and Lot) could not protect them (their wives) from Allah at all, and it was said (to them): “Enter the fire along with those who enter!”

11.Abdul Hye: And Allah has set forth an example for those who believe, the wife of Pharaoh, who said: “My Lord! Build for me a home from You in Paradise and save me from Pharaoh and his work, and save me from the wrongdoer people.”

12.Abdul Hye: And (another example) Mary, the daughter of Imran, who guarded her chastity, and We breathed into it (the sleeve of her shirt or her garment) through Our spirit (Gabriel), and she believed in the Words of her Lord and the Scriptures, and she was among the devout obedient ones (to Allah).

1.Abdul Hye: Blessed be He in Whose authority is the dominion (the universe), and He has power over all things.

2.Abdul Hye: The One (Allah) who has created death and life, so that He may test you (to find out) which of you are best in deed. And He is the All-Mighty, the Forgiving

3.Abdul Hye: The one (Allah) Who has created the 7 heavens one above another, you cannot see any fault in the creations of the Gracious. So look once again, can you see any rifts?

4.Abdul Hye: Then repeat the look again, and yet again, your sight will return to you humbled and it is worn out.

5.Abdul Hye: And indeed We have decorated the nearest heaven with lamps, We have made such lamps as missiles to drive away the devils, and have prepared for them the punishment of the blazing fire.

6.Abdul Hye: And for those who disbelieve in their Lord, there will be the punishment of hell, and worst indeed is that destination.

7.Abdul Hye: When they will be cast in the fire, they will hear the (terrible) drawing of its breath as it blazes out.

8.Abdul Hye: It almost bursts up with fury. Every time a group is cast in it; its keeper will ask: “Did no Warner come to you?”

9.Abdul Hye: They will say: “Yes indeed, a Warner did come to us, but we rejected him and said: Allah has never sent down anything (of revelation), you are only in great error.”

10.Abdul Hye: And they will say: “Had we only listened or used our intelligence, we would not have been among the inmates of the blazing fire!”

11.Abdul Hye: Then they will confess their sin. So, away (from the Mercy of Allah) will be the inmates of the blazing fire.

12.Abdul Hye: Surely! Those who fear their Lord unseen, they will have forgiveness and a great reward (Paradise).

13.Abdul Hye: And whether you keep your talk secret or disclose it, surely, He is All-Knower of what is in the hearts.

14.Abdul Hye: Should not He know Who has created? And He is the Kind, and Courteous (to His servants), All-Aware (of everything).

15.Abdul Hye: It is He Who has made the earth submissive to you, so walk in the path thereof and eat of His provision, and to Him will be (the return) for Resurrection.

16.Abdul Hye: Do you feel secure from He Who is over the heaven, will not cause the earth to sink with you when it shakes (as in an earthquake)?

17.Abdul Hye: Or do you feel secure from He Who is over the heaven, will not send against you a violent tornado? Then you shall know how terrible has been My Warning!

18.Abdul Hye: And indeed those before them denied (the Messengers of Allah), then see how terrible was My denial (punishment)?

19.Abdul Hye: Do they not see the birds above them spreading out their wings and folding them in? None upholds them except the Gracious (Allah). Surely, He is the All-Seer all of everything.

20.Abdul Hye: Who is the one that has an army to help you besides the Gracious? The disbelievers are in nothing but delusion.

21.Abdul Hye: Who is there that can provide you if He withholds His provision? Nay, they continue to be in pride and they flee (from the truth).

22.Abdul Hye: Who is more rightly guided: one who walks with his face bend down without seeing, or the one who sees and walks upright on a Right Way?

23.Abdul Hye: Say: “It is He Who has created you, and made for you hearing, seeing, and hearts. Yet, you give little thanks.”

24.Abdul Hye: Say: “It is He Who has created you in the earth, and to Him you shall be gathered (in the Hereafter).”

25.Abdul Hye: They say: “When will this Promise (the Day of Resurrection) come to pass if you are telling the truth?”

26.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “The knowledge (of its exact time) is only with Allah, and I am only a plain Warner.”

27.Abdul Hye: But, when they will see it (the punishment on the Day of Resurrection) approaching, the faces of those who disbelieve will change with sadness (turn black), and it will be said (to them): “This is the Promise which you were calling for!”

28.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “Even if Allah destroys me and those with me or He bestows His Mercy on us; who will save the disbelievers from a painful punishment?”

29.Abdul Hye: Say: “It is the Gracious (Allah), in Him we believe, and in Him we put our trust. Soon you will come to know who is it that is in clear error.”

30.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “Have you seen that if all your water were to sunk away (in the ground), who then can supply you with flowing water?”

1.Abdul Hye: Nun. By the pen and what they (angels) write (records of people).

2.Abdul Hye: By the Grace of your Lord you (O Muhammad) are not a madman,

3.Abdul Hye: and surely, you (O Muhammad) will have an endless reward.

4.Abdul Hye: And surely, you (O Muhammad) are on an exalted (standard of) character.

5.Abdul Hye: Soon you will see and they will see

6.Abdul Hye: which of you is afflicted with madness.

7.Abdul Hye: Surely, your Lord knows those better who have gone astray from His Way, and He is the Best Knower of those who are guided.

8.Abdul Hye: So (O Muhammad) don’t yield to the deniers (of Islam).

9.Abdul Hye: They wish that you should compromise (in religion with them), so they would also compromise with you.

10.Abdul Hye: Don’t yield to everyone who swears much and is considered worthless,

11.Abdul Hye: a slanderer, going about with mischief,

12.Abdul Hye: opponent of the good, transgressor, sinful

13.Abdul Hye: cruel, and moreover wicked (of illegitimate birth),

14.Abdul Hye: though he has wealth and children.

15.Abdul Hye: When Our Verses (of the Qur’an) are recited to him, he says: “Tales of the people of old!”

16.Abdul Hye: We shall brand the one over the nose!

17.Abdul Hye: Surely, We shall try them as We tried the people of the garden when they swore to pick the fruits of the garden in the morning,

18.Abdul Hye: without saying: If Allah wills.

19.Abdul Hye: Then something (fire) from your Lord passed by on the garden (at night and burnt it) while they were asleep,

20.Abdul Hye: so the garden became black by the morning, like a pitch dark night (completely ruined).

21.Abdul Hye: Then they called out one to another as soon as the morning broke,

22.Abdul Hye: saying: “Go to your tilth in the morning if you want to pick the fruits.”

23.Abdul Hye: So they departed and whispered in secret low tones (saying):

24.Abdul Hye: “Let no poor person enter into the garden today.”

25.Abdul Hye: And then they went in the morning with strong intention, thinking that they have powers (to prevent the poor from taking any of the fruits).

26.Abdul Hye: But when they saw the garden, they said: “Surely, we have gone astray,

27.Abdul Hye: (then they said): Nay! Indeed we have been deprived (of the fruits)!”

28.Abdul Hye: The best among them said: “Did I not tell you: why do you not glorify Allah (If Allah wills)?”

29.Abdul Hye: They said: “Glory to our Lord! Surely, we have been wrongdoers.”

30.Abdul Hye: So they started blaming one another.

31.Abdul Hye: (Later) they said: “Woe to us! Surely, we had become transgressors.

32.Abdul Hye: We hope that our Lord will give us in exchange a better garden than this. Truly, we turn to our Lord.”

33.Abdul Hye: Such is the punishment (in this life) and truly, the punishment of the Hereafter is greater, if they but knew.

34.Abdul Hye: Surely, the pious will be rewarded with gardens of delight (Paradise) by their Lord.

35.Abdul Hye: Shall We then treat the Muslims like the criminals?

36.Abdul Hye: What is the matter with you? How do you judge?

37.Abdul Hye: Or do you have a book from which you learn,

38.Abdul Hye: that you shall have in it all that you choose?

39.Abdul Hye: Or do you have oaths from Us reaching to the Day of Resurrection that your will have whatever you judge?

40.Abdul Hye: Ask if anyone of them will Promise for that!

41.Abdul Hye: Or do they have ‘partners (other deities besides Allah)?’ Then let them bring their ‘partners’ if they are truthful!

42.Abdul Hye: (Remember) the Day (of Judgment) when the events shall be unfolded and they shall be called to prostrate (to Allah), but they shall not be able to do so.

43.Abdul Hye: Their eyes will be cast down, humiliation will cover them; because they used to be called to prostrate (offer prayers), and they were healthy and good (in the world, but they refused to do so).

44.Abdul Hye: Then (O Muhammad) leave Me Alone with those who deny this speech (Qur’an). We shall punish them gradually from where they don’t perceive.

45.Abdul Hye: And I will (even) grant them a respite. Surely, My plan is strong.

46.Abdul Hye: Or have you (O Muhammad) asked them a wage, so they are heavily burdened from debt?

47.Abdul Hye: Or do they have the (knowledge of the) unseen with them, so they can write it down?

48.Abdul Hye: So wait with patience for the decision of your Lord, and don’t be like the companion of the fish (reference to Prophet Jonah who was swallowed by a fish), who cried out (to Us) while he was in distress.

49.Abdul Hye: Had not a Grace from his Lord reached him, he would indeed have been (left in the stomach of the fish, but We forgave him, so he was) cast off on the naked shore, while he was blamed.

50.Abdul Hye: But his Lord chose him and made him of the righteous.

51.Abdul Hye: And surely, the disbelievers would almost make you slip with their eyes (through hatred) when they hear the reminder (the Qur’an), and they say: “Surely, he (Muhammad) is a madman!”

52.Abdul Hye: This (the Qur’an) is nothing but a reminder to all people of the worlds.

1.Abdul Hye: The inevitable (of the Day of Resurrection)!

2.Abdul Hye: What is the inevitable?

3.Abdul Hye: And what will make you understand what the inevitable is?

4.Abdul Hye: Thamud and Ad people denied the calamity (the striking Hour of judgment)!

5.Abdul Hye: As for Thamud, they were destroyed by the awful cry!

6.Abdul Hye: As for Ad, they were destroyed by a furious violent wind,

7.Abdul Hye: which Allah imposed on them for 7 nights and 8 days in succession, so that you could see the people lying overthrown (destroyed) in it as if they were hollow trunks of date-palms!

8.Abdul Hye: Now, do you see any remnants of them?

9.Abdul Hye: And Pharaoh and those before him, and the cities overthrown (the people of Lot) who committed sin

10.Abdul Hye: and they disobeyed their Lord’s Messenger, so He seized them with a strong seize.

11.Abdul Hye: Surely! When the water rose beyond limits (Noah’s flood), We carried you people in the floating ship,

12.Abdul Hye: that We may make it an event of warning for you so that it may be understood by the retaining ears (in memory).

13.Abdul Hye: Then when the Trumpet will be blown with one blowing (first one)

14.Abdul Hye: and the earth with its mountains will be removed (from their places) and crushed with a single crushing,

15.Abdul Hye: then on that Day the great Event will befall,

16.Abdul Hye: and the heaven will split asunder, and for that Day it (heaven) will be frail and torn up.

17.Abdul Hye: And the angels will be on all sides and on that Day 8 angels will bear the Throne of your Lord above them.

18.Abdul Hye: That Day you will be brought to judgment (before your Lord), and not a secret of you will be hidden.

19.Abdul Hye: Then, as for the one who will be given its record (of deeds) in its right hand, will say: “Here! read my record!

20.Abdul Hye: Surely, I did believe that I shall meet my account!”

21.Abdul Hye: So he shall have a life of well-pleasing,

22.Abdul Hye: in a lofty Paradise,

23.Abdul Hye: with fruits in bunches which will be low and near at hand.

24.Abdul Hye: (It will be said him): “Eat and drink at ease, (this is the reward) for what you did sent on before in past days!”

25.Abdul Hye: But as for the one who will be given its record (of deeds) in its left hand, will say: “I wish that I had not been given my record (of deeds)

26.Abdul Hye: and that I had never known what my account was?

27.Abdul Hye: I wish if only it had been my end (death)!

28.Abdul Hye: My wealth has availed me nothing,

29.Abdul Hye: my power and arguments (to defend myself) have gone from me!”

30.Abdul Hye: (It will be said): “Seize him and fetter (with a chain around its neck),

31.Abdul Hye: then throw him in the blazing fire,

32.Abdul Hye: then fasten him with a chain of 70 cubits long!

33.Abdul Hye: Surely, he did not believe in Allah, the Great,

34.Abdul Hye: and did not urge on the feeding of the poor.

35.Abdul Hye: This Day he has neither a friend here,

36.Abdul Hye: nor any food except the filth from the washing of wounds,

37.Abdul Hye: which none will eat except the sinners.”

38.Abdul Hye: So, surely I swear by whatever you see,

39.Abdul Hye: and by whatever you don’t see,

40.Abdul Hye: that surely this is the word of an honored Messenger.

41.Abdul Hye: It is not the word of a poet, little is that you believe,

42.Abdul Hye: nor it is the word of a soothsayer, little is that you remember.

43.Abdul Hye: This is the revelation sent down from the Lord of the worlds.

44.Abdul Hye: Had he (Muhammad) forged false sayings concerning Us,

45.Abdul Hye: We certainly would have seized him by his right hand

46.Abdul Hye: then certainly would have cut off his life arter

47.Abdul Hye: and none of you could prevent (Us) from punishing him.

48.Abdul Hye: Surely this (Qur’an) is a reminder for the pious.

49.Abdul Hye: Surely We know that there are some among you who deny (the Qur’an)

50.Abdul Hye: and indeed it (this Qur’an) will be an anguish for the disbelievers.

51.Abdul Hye: Yet, it (this Qur’an) is an absolute truth with certainty.

52.Abdul Hye: So glorify the name of your Lord, the Great.

1.Abdul Hye: A questioner asked concerning a punishment about to befal

2.Abdul Hye: upon the disbelievers, none can avert.

3.Abdul Hye: (It will come) from Allah, the Lord of the Ways of Ascent.

4.Abdul Hye: The angels and the spirit (Gabriel) ascend to Him in a Day the measure of which is 50,000 years

5.Abdul Hye: So be patient (O Muhammad) with a good patience.

6.Abdul Hye: Surely! They see it (Day of judgment) to be far off;

7.Abdul Hye: but We see it quite near.

8.Abdul Hye: On that Day, the sky will be like molten lead

9.Abdul Hye: and the mountains will be like flakes of wool;

10.Abdul Hye: and no friend will ask of a friend

11.Abdul Hye: though they will be made to see one another (no one can help including relatives). The criminal would wish to ransom himself from the punishment of that Day by his children,

12.Abdul Hye: his wife and his brother,

13.Abdul Hye: his kindred who gave him shelter,

14.Abdul Hye: and all that is in the earth, so that it might save him.

15.Abdul Hye: But no means! Surely, it will be the fire of hell

16.Abdul Hye: to take away (burn completely) the head skin,

17.Abdul Hye: he will call all those who turn their backs and turn away their faces,

18.Abdul Hye: who collected (wealth) and hide it (from spending in the cause of Allah).

19.Abdul Hye: Surely, human has been created very impatient,

20.Abdul Hye: when the evil touches them, they are distressed,

21.Abdul Hye: but when good (fortune) touches them, they are stingy

22.Abdul Hye: except those who devote to prayers,

23.Abdul Hye: those who remain steadfast in their prayers,

24.Abdul Hye: those who set aside a known right in their wealth

25.Abdul Hye: for the beggar who asks and for the deprived (who lost property and wealth),

26.Abdul Hye: those who believe in the Day of recompense,

27.Abdul Hye: those who fear the punishment of their Lord,

28.Abdul Hye: surely! The punishment of their Lord is that before which none can feel secure,

29.Abdul Hye: those who guard their chastity (private parts from illegal sex),

30.Abdul Hye: except with their wives or those whom their right hands possess so they are not to be blamed.

31.Abdul Hye: But those who seek to go beyond this, then it is those who are transgressors.

32.Abdul Hye: And those who keep their trusts and their covenants,

33.Abdul Hye: and those who stand firm in their testimonies

34.Abdul Hye: and those who guard their prayers well

35.Abdul Hye: it is they who will be in the gardens (Paradise) with honor.

36.Abdul Hye: So what is the matter with the disbelievers that they hasten to listen from you (O Muhammad),

37.Abdul Hye: sitting in groups on the right and on the left (of you, O Muhammad)?

38.Abdul Hye: Does every one of them seek to enter the Paradise of delight?

39.Abdul Hye: But nay! Surely, We have created them out of that which they (disbelievers) know.

40.Abdul Hye: So, I (Muhammad) swear by the Lord of all points of sunrise in the east and sunset in the west that surely We are Able (to destroy them

41.Abdul Hye: and can replace them by others better than them; and We are not to be outrun.

42.Abdul Hye: So, leave them to plunge in vain talk and play about, until they meet their Day which they are promised.

43.Abdul Hye: The Day when they will come out of the graves quickly as if they are racing towards a goal

44.Abdul Hye: with their eyes lowered in fear and humility, covering them with disgrace! That is the Day which they are promised!

1.Abdul Hye: Surely, We sent Noah to his people (saying): “Warn your people before there comes to them a painful punishment.”

2.Abdul Hye: He said: “O my people! Surely, I am sent to you as a plain Warner.

3.Abdul Hye: That you should worship Allah (alone), be dutiful to Him, and obey me.

4.Abdul Hye: (If you do so) He will forgive you of your sins and give you respite for an appointed term. Surely, the term of Allah when it comes, cannot be delayed, if you but knew.”

5.Abdul Hye: (After all his efforts were exhausted) he said: “O my Lord! Surely, I have called my people night and day,

6.Abdul Hye: but all my calling added nothing but to their flight (from the truth).

7.Abdul Hye: Surely! Every time I called to them that Allah might forgive them, they put their fingers into their ears, covered themselves up with their garments, persisted (in their refusal), and magnified themselves in pride.

8.Abdul Hye: Surely, I called them openly (aloud),

9.Abdul Hye: then surely, I proclaimed to them in public, and I have appealed to them in private,

10.Abdul Hye: I said (to them): ‘Ask forgiveness from your Lord; He is Forgiving

11.Abdul Hye: He will send the sky (rain) to you in abundance,

12.Abdul Hye: help you with increase in wealth and children, bestow on you gardens, and bestow on you rivers.’”

13.Abdul Hye: And what is the matter with that you don’t have any hope (from Allah)

14.Abdul Hye: and surely He has created you in stages?

15.Abdul Hye: Don’t you see how Allah has created the 7 heavens one above another,

16.Abdul Hye: and has made the moon as a light in it and made the sun as a lamp?

17.Abdul Hye: And Allah has brought you out as a growth from the (dust of) earth

18.Abdul Hye: Then He will return you into it (the same earth), and bring you forth (to life again on the Day of Resurrection)?

19.Abdul Hye: And Allah has made for you the earth as a wide sprea

20.Abdul Hye: so that you may go about in it on broad roads.

21.Abdul Hye: Noah said: “My Lord! Surely they have disobeyed me, and followed those whose wealth and children give them no increase but only loss.

22.Abdul Hye: They have plotted a mighty plot,

23.Abdul Hye: and they have said: ‘Don’t leave your deity, nor shall you leave Wadd, nor Suwa, nor Yaghuth, nor Yauq, nor Nasr (names of the idols).’

24.Abdul Hye: Indeed they have led many astray. (O Allah): don’t increase the wrongdoers (in anything) but error.”

25.Abdul Hye: Because of their sins they were drowned (in the flood) and were made to enter the fire. They did not find any help for them instead of Allah.

26.Abdul Hye: And Noah said: “My Lord! Don’t leave any inhabitant of the disbelievers on the earth!

27.Abdul Hye: Surely if You leave them, they will mislead Your servants and they will beget none but wicked disbelievers.

28.Abdul Hye: My Lord! Forgive me, and my parents, and those who enter my home as a believer, and all the believing men and women. And You don’t grant increase to the wrongdoers but destruction!”

1.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “It has been revealed to me that a group of jinns listened (to the Qur’an). They (returned to their folk and) said: ‘Surely! We have heard a wonderful recitation (this Qur’an),

2.Abdul Hye: it guides to the Right Way. We have believed in it and we shall never join (in worship) anything with our Lord.

3.Abdul Hye: And surely, the majesty of our Lord is exalted: He has neither taken a wife nor a son.

4.Abdul Hye: And the foolish among us have been uttering against Allah which was wrong and not right

5.Abdul Hye: surely, we thought that no human or jinns could utter a lie against Allah.

6.Abdul Hye: And surely, there were people among mankind used to seek refuge with individuals among the jinns, so they (jinns) increased them (mankind) in sin and arrogance,

7.Abdul Hye: and they thought as you thought that Allah will never appoint anyone (as a Messenger to mankind or jinn).

8.Abdul Hye: And we have sought to reach the heaven but found it filled with stern guards and flaming fires.

9.Abdul Hye: We used to sit there at stations (heaven) to steal a hearing, but those who listen now find flaming fire (stars) watching in ambush for them.

10.Abdul Hye: We did not know whether an evil was intended for those on earth, or whether their Lord intends for them a Right Way.

11.Abdul Hye: There are some among us who are righteous, and some of us contrary to that; we are groups on different ways (religious sect).

12.Abdul Hye: And we know that we can neither escape (punishment of) Allah in the earth nor can we escape (punishment of) Him by flight.

13.Abdul Hye: And indeed, when we heard the guidance (this Qur’an), we believed in it; and those who believe in their Lord shall have neither fear of any loss nor any oppression.

14.Abdul Hye: And surely, there are some among us who are Muslims and some who are deviators from the truth. Those who have embraced Islam have found the Right Way,

15.Abdul Hye: as for the unjust deviators (from truth), they will be firewood for hell.

16.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “If they (the Makkans) had stood upright on the Right Way (Islam), We would surely have bestowed on them water (rain) in abundance,

17.Abdul Hye: so that We might test them thereby. And those who turn away from the reminder of their Lord (this Qur’an), He will cause them to enter in a severe punishment (hell).

18.Abdul Hye: And the Masjids are built for Allah’s worship alone, so don’t invoke anyone along with Allah.

19.Abdul Hye: And yet, when the servant of Allah (Muhammad) stood up invoking Him in prayer, they (the jinns) just were around him in a dense crowd (to listen to the Prophet’s recitation).”

20.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “I only pray to my Lord, and I associate none as partners with Him.”

21.Abdul Hye: Say: “Surely I don’t have power to cause you harm, nor bring you the Right Way.

22.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “(If I were to disobey Him) none can protect me from Allah’s punishment, nor can I find refuge except in Him.

23.Abdul Hye: (My mission is) only to convey the truth from Allah and His Messages. Those who disobey Allah and His Messenger, then surely, they will be put in the fire of hell to reside in it forever.”

24.Abdul Hye: Till, when they will see (the punishment) that which they are Promised, then they will know whose helpers are weak and whose (supporters) are less in numbers.

25.Abdul Hye: Say (O Muhammad): “I don’t know whether (punishment) which you are Promised is near or whether my Lord has appointed for it a distant term.

26.Abdul Hye: (He alone is) the All-Knower of the unseen, and He does not reveal His unseen to anyon

27.Abdul Hye: except to the Messenger whom He has chosen. Then He makes a band of watching guards (angels) to march before him and behind him,

28.Abdul Hye: so that He may know that surely they (the Messengers) have conveyed the messages of their Lord. And He surrounds all their surroundings and He keeps a count of all things.”

73.SurahEnglishNames: The Enshrouded One, Bundled Up, The Mantled One

1.Abdul Hye: O you wrapped in garments (Muhammad)!

2.Abdul Hye: Stand to pray all night, except a little,

3.Abdul Hye: half of it or a little less than that,

4.Abdul Hye: or add to it (little more), and recite the Qur’an in a slow, (pleasant tone) style.

5.Abdul Hye: Surely, We shall soon send down to you a weighty Word (obligations).

6.Abdul Hye: Surely, the rising by night (for Tahajjud prayer) is very hard, most potent, and most suitable (to understand) for the Word (of Qur’an),

7.Abdul Hye: surely, during the day there is prolonged occupation for you with ordinary duties.

8.Abdul Hye: And remember the Name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with a complete devotion.

9.Abdul Hye: He is the Lord of the east and the west: there is no one worthy of worship but He. So take Him alone as your Guardian.

10.Abdul Hye: And be patient (O Muhammad) with what they say and keep away from them, withdraw (leave) in a good way.

11.Abdul Hye: And leave Me alone to deal with the deniers who are in possession of good things of life. Give them respite for a little while.

12.Abdul Hye: Surely, We have fetters (in store to bind them) and a raging fire,

13.Abdul Hye: and a food that chokes, and a painful punishment.

14.Abdul Hye: On the Day when the earth and the mountains will be in a violent shake, the mountains will be a heap of sand poured out and flowing.

15.Abdul Hye: Surely, We have sent to you (O mankind) a Messenger (Muhammad) to be a witness over you, as We sent a Messenger (Moses) to Pharaoh.

16.Abdul Hye: But Pharaoh disobeyed the Messenger (Moses); so We seized him with a severe seize.

17.Abdul Hye: If you disbelieve, how will you avoid the punishment on that Day (of Resurrection) which will turn the children grey-headed (old),

18.Abdul Hye: the heaven will split asunder? His Promise will certainly be fulfilled

19.Abdul Hye: Surely, this is an admonition, so let them who will, take a way to their Lord!

20.Abdul Hye: Surely, your Lord knows that you stand (to pray at night) a little less than 2/3rd of the night, or ½ of the night, or 1/3rd of the night, also a party of those with you. And Allah measures the night and the day. He knows that you can never calculate it (unable to pray the whole night), so He has turned to you (in Mercy). So, recite from the Qur’an as much as may be easy for you. He knows that there may be some sick among you, and some others who travel through the land to seek Allah’s Bounty; and yet, some others who fight in Allah’s cause. So recite as much of it (Qur’an) as may be easy for you, establish prayer, pay obligatory charity, and lend to Allah a goodly loan. And whatever good you will send before you (leave the world) for yourselves, you will certainly find it with Allah, which is better and greater in reward. And seek the forgiveness of Allah. Surely, Allah is Forgiving, Merciful.

74.SurahEnglishNames: The Cloaked One, The Man Wearing a Cloak, The Clothed One

1.Abdul Hye: O you (Muhammad) enveloped (in garments)!

2.Abdul Hye: Arise and warn.

3.Abdul Hye: Proclaim (the greatness  of) your Lord (Allah),

4.Abdul Hye: and purify your garments,

5.Abdul Hye: and keep away from filth (idols),

6.Abdul Hye: and don’t give a thing to have more (obey Allah not as a Favor to Him)

7.Abdul Hye: and be patient for the sake of your Lord!

8.Abdul Hye: When the trumpet will be sounded,

9.Abdul Hye: surely, that Day will be a hard Day,

10.Abdul Hye: not easy for the disbelievers.

11.Abdul Hye: Leave Me alone to deal with whom I created alone (without any means, including Al-Walid bin Al-Mughirah, a bitter opponent of the prophet)!

12.Abdul Hye: and Allah granted him abundant resources,

13.Abdul Hye: and children by his side,

14.Abdul Hye: and made life smooth and comfortable for him.

15.Abdul Hye: Yet, he desires that I should give more.

16.Abdul Hye: Nay! Surely, he has been stubborn and opposing to Our revelations.

17.Abdul Hye: I shall soon oblige him to face (climb a slippery mountain in the hellfire) a severe punishment,

18.Abdul Hye: surely, he thought and plotted.

19.Abdul Hye: So let him be cursed, how he plotted!

20.Abdul Hye: And (again) let him be cursed, how he plotted!

21.Abdul Hye: Then he thought,

22.Abdul Hye: then frowned and looked in a bad tempered way,

23.Abdul Hye: then he turned his back and was proud

24.Abdul Hye: and he said: “This is nothing but a magic from the old,

25.Abdul Hye: this is nothing but the word of a human being.”

26.Abdul Hye: I will burn him in hellfire.

27.Abdul Hye: And what will make you know exactly what hellfire is?

28.Abdul Hye: It does not spare (any sinner), nor does it leave (anything not burnt)!

29.Abdul Hye: Fire burns the skins.

30.Abdul Hye: Over it are 19 (angels as guardians and keepers of hell).

31.Abdul Hye: And We have set none but angels as guardians of the fire. We have not fixed their numbers (19) except as a trial for those who disbelieve in order that those who were given the Scripture may be convinced (Qur’an is the truth as it agrees with their books i.e. number (19) is written in the Torah and the Gospel). Those who believe may increase in faith (in Qur’an). Those who were given the Scripture and believers may say to those in whose hearts there is a disease (hypocrisy) and the disbelievers say: “What Allah means by this example?” Allah leads astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. No one knows the forces of your Lord but He. This (Qur’an) is nothing but a reminder to mankind.

32.Abdul Hye: Nay, by the moon

33.Abdul Hye: and by the night when it withdraws

34.Abdul Hye: and by the dawn when it brightens,

35.Abdul Hye: surely, it (hell) is one of the greatest signs,

36.Abdul Hye: and a warning to mankind,

37.Abdul Hye: to any of you that chooses to go forward (by righteous deeds), or remain behind (by sins).

38.Abdul Hye: Every person is held in a pledge for what he has earned,

39.Abdul Hye: except those on the right (true believers),

40.Abdul Hye: in gardens (Paradise) they will ask one another,

41.Abdul Hye: about the criminals. (They will say to them):

42.Abdul Hye: “What has caused you to enter into hell?”

43.Abdul Hye: They will say: “We were not of those who used to offer prayers,

44.Abdul Hye: nor we used to feed the poor,

45.Abdul Hye: we used to talk falsehood with vain talkers

46.Abdul Hye: and we used to deny the Day of recompense,

47.Abdul Hye: until there came to us the certainty (death).”

48.Abdul Hye: (On that Day) no intercession of intercessors will be of any use to them.

49.Abdul Hye: Then what is wrong with them (disbelievers) that they turn away from receiving the admonition?

50.Abdul Hye: As if they were frightened donkeys

51.Abdul Hye: fleeing from a hunter, or a lion, or a beast of prey.

52.Abdul Hye: Nay, everyone of them desires that he should be given pages spread out (writing from Allah that Islam is the right religion).

53.Abdul Hye: Nay! But they don’t fear the Hereafter (Allah’s punishment).

54.Abdul Hye: Nay, surely, this (Qur’an) is an admonition.

55.Abdul Hye: So whoever wills (let him read it), will reflect on it.

56.Abdul Hye: And they will not take heed unless Allah wills. He is the One deserves that mankind should be afraid of Him. He is the One Who forgives.

75.SurahEnglishNames: The Rising of the Dead, Resurrection

2.Abdul Hye: and I swear by the self-reproaching person (believer)!

3.Abdul Hye: Does mankind think that We shall not assemble their bones?

5.Abdul Hye: But mankind desires to continue committing sins.

6.Abdul Hye: He (mankind) asks: “When will be this Day of Resurrection?”

7.Abdul Hye: So, (it will come) when the sight will be dazed,

8.Abdul Hye: the moon will be eclipsed,

9.Abdul Hye: and the sun and moon will  be joined together:

10.Abdul Hye: on that Day mankind will say: “Where (is the refuge) to flee?”

11.Abdul Hye: No! There will be no refuge!

12.Abdul Hye: On that Day, the place of rest will only be to your Lord.

13.Abdul Hye: On that Day mankind will be informed of (their deeds) what they sent forward and what they left behind.

14.Abdul Hye: Nay! Mankind will be witness against themselves (body parts will speak about deeds),

15.Abdul Hye: though they may put forth their excuses (to cover evil deeds).

47.Abdul Hye: Woe on that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!

49.Abdul Hye: Woe on that Day to the deniers (of the Day of Resurrection)!

1.Abdul Hye: About what are they asking (one another)?

2.Abdul Hye: Allah is the Self-Sufficient (Samad: independent of all, while all are dependent on Allah);

3.Abdul Hye: He begets not, nor is He begotten,

4.Abdul Hye: and there is none comparable to Him.”

1.Abdul Hye: Say: “I seek refuge with the Lord of the Daybreak

2.Abdul Hye: from the evil of what He has created,

3.Abdul Hye: and from the evil of the darkness (night) as it comes with its darkness,

4.Abdul Hye: and from the evil of the witches who blow in the knots (black magic),

5.Abdul Hye: and from the evil of the envier when one envies.”

1.Abdul Hye: Say: “I seek refuge with the Lord of mankind,

2.Abdul Hye: the Owner of mankind,

3.Abdul Hye: the real One worthy of worship of mankind,

4.Abdul Hye: from the evil of the sneaking whispers (Satan and its workers)

5.Abdul Hye: who whispers into the hearts of people,

6.Abdul Hye: from (among) the jinns and mankind.”
